campaign.story:
There’s gold in the Black Hills of South Dakota, and you’ve come to find (or steal) your share. You’re staying at one of the three major establishments in Deadwood where you and your associates are working together to steal some of the gold-filled safes floating around town. But you suspect that the “friends” you’re working with are secretly plotting to keep all the gold for themselves. Will you be ready to turn on them before they shoot you in the back?
Deadwood 1876 is a social deduction game where you'll work with teammates to find and collect gold. But in the end, the team with the most gold will have to fight each other to the death to determine the winner! Will you spend your turns helping your team find gold, or preparing to defeat your own teammates in the Final Showdown?
2-9 Players. 20-40 minutes. Ages 13+.
1 Magnetic book box
1 Faux leather pouch
1 Rulebook (includes character biographies and Deadwood history)
3 Wood carved platforms
9 Wood star pawns
10 Wood engraved dice
79 cards (9 Characters, 20 Safes, 50 Deadwood)
The game comes in a magnetically-closing faux book. Extra room is provided in the center section should you desire to sleeve the cards.
The wood establishment platforms conjure the look of an old western storefront. Since each platform is stained and laser cut, the wood grain and color will be slightly unique in each copy of the game. The platforms are laser cut in the negative space, so each letter and design comes outwards.
The ten wooden dice each use custom designs instead of standard dots. Each colored dice corresponds to a gun in the game and has different values depending on the gun. Each die is colored and engraved.
 Nine wooden stars act as the pawns in the game.
 The dice and stars come in a faux leather bag.
The 9 characters are based on people who actually lived in or visited Deadwood in 1876. Character biographies are included in the rule book. Each character card is colored on the front, and black and white on the back.
The 20 Safe cards are designed to look like genuine safes from the 1870's.
Each of the 50 Deadwood cards contains a gun on top and a special item on the bottom.
In Deadwood 1876 you’ll use cards from your hand to try to win Safes from other players. Safes contain Badges, Gold, or Showdown Guns. Near the end of the game, players with Badges get extra turns. After the final turn, the team with the most Gold will advance to the Final Showdown. There, teammates will have to fight each other to the death using Showdown Guns. The last person alive is the winner!
Note: The video above gives a brief overview of rules. Strategy tips, rule clarifications, advanced optional rules, card descriptions, and character biographies are all included in the game rule book. We currently have rules available to view in English, German, French, Italian, Spanish and Dutch on our website. You can also view the contents of this page in Chinese.
Valuable items are hidden behind each Safe. You won't know which Safes have been shuffled in, so every round will play out differently.
Each player always has 4 Deadwood cards in their hand. You'll get to play one card from your hand each turn, and then it will be replaced from the deck.
Each card can either be used as the gun listed on top, or the special item listed on the bottom. The Holster lets you help out teammates, the Stetson lets you view hidden Safes, the Horse lets you abandon your team for a different one, and the Duster lets you improve your hand of cards.
The more powerful guns, such as the Messenger, have higher values on its dice, whereas worse guns, such as the Pepperbox, have lower values and zeros on its dice.  For shootouts you'll need to manage your hand and decide when to use a powerful gun and when to gamble with your weaker guns.
Each player takes on the identity of one of nine people who actually roamed the streets of Deadwood.
A game in progress.
This game requires teamwork, but also actively punishes you if you play too nice. That balance makes every round insane. - Sam J.
Mix strategy with the best and the worst of the Wild West, and you get Deadwood. - Charlotte C.
The strategy never gets old and I consistently find myself playing with new options every single game. -Spencer H.
Backstabbing has never been so much fun. This game keeps you on your toes. It is not one you can play half-heartedly. -Abigail S.
The more I play Deadwood, the less likely I am to trust other players. When I trust them too much, they take my gold and shoot me with a gun they stole from me. I always regret it. -Patti S.
Intrigues of Deadwood 1876 video from Beasts of War.
A great game (in our opinion), needs three things: solid mechanics, an awesome theme, and beautiful design.
Mechanics
Deadwood is a balance between teamwork and selfishness. If a player uses all of their best Deadwood cards and Badges to hunt down Gold for their team, they’ll be defenseless to fight against their teammates in the Final Showdown. But if a player only goes after Showdown Guns and saves all of their best cards, their team might not have enough Gold to actually reach the Final Showdown. If someone on your team doesn’t seem to be pulling their weight, they’re probably plotting to use your Gold to reach the Final Showdown and then destroy you! There may come a point when you need to attack, mislead, frame, abandon, or banish your own teammates.
Theme
When we were searching for the city for the 3rd Volume in the Dark Cities Series, we fell in love with Deadwood almost immediately upon learning about it. Large deposits of gold were discovered in the Black Hills of South Dakota in late 1875. Word quickly spread about the gold and the town of Deadwood was born almost overnight in early 1876. It soon reached a population of 5,000 miners, gamblers, prostitutes, outlaws, and businessmen. Lawlessness was prevalent as people flocked to the town to find (or steal) their share of the gold. Deadwood quickly became an infamous western town where old west legends lived and died.
The book has a raised UV effect so that all designs and logos pop out from the cover and spine.
Design
The illustrations from Sarah Keele and graphic design from Holly Hancock take players into the world of the wild wild west! We used wood and leather textures with our components, old west Victorian charm with our book and character cards, and cards that look like antiqued metal Safes built by the "Facade Safe & Lock Co" similar to Safes from the time period. The goal of our design is to take you and your friends deep into the raucous, chaotic, exciting world of Deadwood, South Dakota in its prime. You can view time-lapse videos of Sarah illustrating Molly Johnson, Solomon Star, Seth Bullock, Kitty Leroy, and the Holster.
We've already made many "premium" choices for the game (wooden platforms instead of cardboard, faux leather bag instead of plastic, wooden star tokens instead of standard pawns, faux book instead of standard box, etc.), because we believe in publishing awesome games regardless of funding amounts. But if we reach the following milestones, we'll be able to make Deadwood 1876 even better!
Note: Some of these upgrades will be exclusive to the 1st Edition of Deadwood 1876. Backing on Kickstarter is the only way to guarantee that all upgrades listed above will be included in your copy of the game.
We've been working hard on logistics all year and for this campaign we're very pleased to offer free US shipping at all reward levels, and low international shipping rates. We are also using fulfillment companies around the world so that you won't be charged extra customs fees. If you are mistakenly charged customs fees when the games arrive, just let us know and we'll pay you back. (For EU backers, we will be shipping games from Germany so you won't have extra customs fees)
Because of cheaper shipping, we’re happy to be selling Deadwood 1876 at prices that are even cheaper than the early bird levels of our previous two Kickstarter projects!
Deadwood 1876 is Volume 3 in the Dark Cities Series! Each Volume is a stand-alone game that comes in the same sized faux book box, focuses on a particular city and year, and includes a dark or mysterious element in its game play. 
Volume 1: Tortuga 1667 (Published 2017 thanks to Kickstarter!). Click the links to view the original Kickstarter campaign or our website. Tortuga was recently nominated as the best party game of 2017 by Board Game Geek!
Volume 2: Salem 1692 (Published as "Salem" in 2015 thanks to Kickstarter! Second edition published as "Salem 1692" in 2017). Click the links to view the original Kickstarter campaign or our website.
Both of our released games have sold over 20,000 copies and are now played around the world! We're already hard at work on Volume 4, and we will continue expanding the series. We know your game closet is a mess. Start your bookshelf collection of games with the Dark Cities Series! See Add-Ons section below for details.
If your pledge includes at least one copy of Deadwood 1876 then you can add an unlimited amount of Tortuga 1667, Salem 1692, or extra copies of Deadwood 1876 to your pledge! Just add the indicated amounts below to your pledge amount without changing your reward level. After the campaign we'll send out a survey where you'll select which games you'd like to be added to your order based on how much extra money you pledged. If you have any questions, please see the FAQ section or shoot us a message.
Your shipping cost does not increase at all regardless of your location or the amount of add-ons you order. You will receive all add-on items at the same time that all of the Kickstarter rewards are received (estimated delivery October 2018).
 Examples:
You are outside the US and want 2 copies of each game. Select the $43 reward level and pledge $129 ($43 two-copies reward level + $6 reward level int'l shipping + $40 two add-ons of Salem + $40 two add-ons of Tortuga).
You are in the US and want 6 copies of Deadwood, 1 copy of Salem, and 10 copies of Tortuga. Select the $110 reward level and pledge $300 ($110 six-copies reward level  + $20 Salem add-on + $170 Tortuga large group add-on). 
If you want Deadwood and Salem, Deadwood and Tortuga, or one of each game, we have reward levels available for those options.
Our illustrator Sarah Keele wants to turn you into a Dark Cities character! During the campaign Sarah is offering a limited number of discounted custom portraits in her shop! We will then turn this portrait into a card that you'll be able to use during game play in your copy of Deadwood 1876!
Custom Character Cards are also available in her shop for Tortuga 1667 and Salem 1692. Discounts are also available in her shop during the campaign for other art from the game.
Follow her instagram for other giveaways and discounts.
We will send a survey to the email associated with your Kickstarter account on April 10th using the CrowdOx pledge manager system. You will be able to choose your add-on orders and provide your shipping information at that time. If you change addresses before we ship your rewards, you will be able to access your survey at this link anytime after April 10th: https://app.crowdox.com/retrieve/travishancock/deadwood-1876-a-safe-robbing-game-of-teamwork-and
Game creation and graphic design is by Facade Games, owned and operated by Travis and Holly Hancock (and our little cheerleader Margo). Learn more at www.facadegames.com, or follow us on facebook, instagram, or twitter.
Illustrations were drawn by Sarah Keele. Follow her beautiful artwork on instagram.
Photography was by Jes Childress. See more of her pictures at her website. 
A huge thank you to the hundreds of hours put in by our many play-testers. This game would not exist without your ideas, feedback, and criticisms. Thank you!
We fell in love with the Kickstarter community when we launched our first game, Salem. We had another great experience with the launch of our second game, Tortuga 1667. The feedback, support, trust, and positivity from the community was incredible. We're proud to reward our Kickstarter backers with discounts on the very 1st edition of the game, the lowest shipping costs we can offer, first-in-line knowledge and insight into the project, and a direct line of communication to us as the creators. We also take your feedback into account before launching production. We consider each Kickstarter backer to be a close ally in our game-making endeavors and we'll do everything we can to protect your trust in us.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As you can see from our photos, samples of the game have already been produced by our manufacturers and designs are complete. We just need to raise the funds and say go! We will do everything in our power to achieve on-time delivery, and we will reach out concerning any unforeseen circumstances. Our first two projects, Salem and Tortuga 1667, were delivered on time to backers as promised. 

Salem: "I have backed over 46 projects and I just wanted to say this project has been an absolute delight to have been a backer for. Your updates have been insightful, but not overbearing. You clearly put a lot of time, thought, and effort into this game and it really shows. I was impressed with how fast this project came together. It was a fast, well organized campaign. Kudos to you and thank you for a wonderful end product. I couldn't be happier." -Snuffles00

Tortuga 1667: "I backed this and another project that ended a day prior at the same time as my first kickstarters. The way things have gone with the other project have given me an even greater appreciation for not only the great game you made, but the well executed Kicktarter. Thank you again!" -Bored Gamer

Please never hesitate to message us directly with comments, concerns, or suggestions.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: We Just Launched the Next Dark Cities Game!
updates.update_content:
Deadwood 1876 Backers and Friends,
We just launched the next volume in the Dark Cities Series on Kickstarter! You are the first people to know. It is called Bristol 1350.

Backers and Friends,
It has been so rewarding to hear about your first reviews and experiences with Deadwood 1876. We hope you enjoy the game for many years to come!
This will be our final update regarding Deadwood 1876

Backers and Friends, 
We hope you are doing well! Here is a quick update for each part of the world regarding your Deadwood 1876 delivery. 
USA

Backers and Friends,
Your games are still on schedule for an October delivery! Here is a quick update:
UK & Europe
You will be receiving an email from our European fulfillment partner, Spiral Galaxy, sometime this week to double check your shipping address. You can respond to them directly to correct any errors. They will then start shipping your games early next week. Please be patient, as the games won't all ship at once.

Backers and Friends,
Good news! Deadwood 1876 is beginning its journey across the ocean from our factory to our fulfillment centers! The boat headed for Europe is already on the water, and the boat to the USA is getting loaded at the port as we speak. Both are scheduled to arrive near the end of September.
That puts us right on schedule for an October delivery! Sometimes crazy things happen on the ocean or at ports, so we'll keep you posted if there are any unexpected delays.

Backers and Friends,
Production is still on schedule! This month the factory is assembling and shrink-wrapping the final components, and everything should be ready to get on the boat by the end of the month. The games will take about 6-8 weeks to cross the ocean, and then we'll have the games sent to you from our fulfillment partners.
Here's a fun picture from the factory of some of the completed books.

Backers and Friends,
Production is right on schedule! Here is a look at the final production pieces and card proofs straight from our factory:

Backers and Friends,
We have an update regarding two of your stretch goals:
First, the illustration for the inside cover of the book is nearly complete! We’ve been able to implement many of your ideas and suggestions and Sarah has done an incredible job. You’ll notice some fun little Easter eggs scattered throughout the picture. Here’s a sneak peak, and we’ll be sure to show you how it looks when it’s finished and colored.

Backers and Friends,
We hope that you all are doing well! We're hard at work finalizing Deadwood 1876 with our factory, and we're excited to show you updates soon!
Today an email will be sent to you from our pledge manager system called CrowdOx. This email will give you access to the backer survey.

updates.update_userinfo: The End of a Journey & the Start of a New!
updates.update_content:
Backers and Friends,
The campaign has officially ended and it raised $587,340 and received pledges from 14,002 backers! We will forever be grateful to you for bringing Deadwood 1876 to life!
On September 2nd, 2016 the first version of Deadwood 1876 (which was called Tombstone 1880 at the time) was born. The game saw many twists, turns, subtractions, additions, and outright obliterations until literally 81 versions (and hundreds of tests) later it was finally finished. This game certainly took its time developing its delightfully deceitful personality, but we couldn’t be happier with how it turned out. Here are a few peaks into some of our versions along the way:

project_data.project_name: Deadwood 1876: A Safe-Robbing Game of Teamwork & Betrayal

campaign.story:
Intaglio
More than just a deck of playing cards.
Intaglio is a series of prints & playing cards derived from hand engraved copper printing plates printed in the traditional Intaglio style in a collaboration between Kings Wild Project and Thornwillow Press in New York. Intaglio printing for playing card art has not been used for centuries. Why has this art style been lost? For this art and printing style to come to life, several factors must exist and come together at the same time. One factor is the skill of the artist. Intaglio engraving takes years of patience and practice to become proficient in. Another factor is that the equipment is not readily available. And lastly, finding someone with the equipment plus the ability to print them at a high archival quality is near impossible. One can see why attempting a project like is a monumental task.
For me as an artist, the Intaglio project is a realization of a long dream of mine to create a deck of cards by hand engraving the artwork. Over the years I have designed things by hand drawing or digitally mimicking engraving, but this project is the next step for me as an artist. The reason for me embarking on this project are two-fold. One reason is that I have a passion for this beautiful art style. The other reason is that as an artist I love the challenge that this offer me to try to accomplish a project such as this.
An inspiration for this deck is one of the first decks that made me originally fall in love with playing card design. Titled the "New Era No. 46" and name such to symbolize a new era of beautiful playing card design heading into the 20th century. I have long wanted to use the New Era court set as inspiration and create my own "engraving" style versions of them, and I felt this was the project to do it. The interesting thing about the New Era No 46 deck is that it was published around the same time that the actual printing presses that will be used for the Intaglio project were created. For me, this project, in a way, is a new era. I am finally getting to pursue the art style of engraving to its physical form.
Thank you for visiting my project, and thank you for helping it become a reality and becoming a backer.
 Pledge Tiers
                                                            This project is a collaboration between Kings Wild Project and Thornwillow Press.
 Thornwillow's Story
The Kickstarter video was created by Six Foot Five Productions.
Important Notice: All Images are conceptual renderings and representations of what the intended final product is supposed to look like. We have done our best to represent our vision honestly and as close to final as possible. With a project of this nature please know that the final product and or designs may very than the images shown. If changes are made we will do our best to communicate those changes clearly.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always risks and challenges with any Kickstarter. This Kickstarter IS my biggest undertaking yet! There are so many moving parts and things that have to work together "just right" for this project to work. My past experiences with being a Kickstarter creator have taught many lessons. My pledge to you as a backer and supporter of this project is to be completely honest and completely transparent about the entire process. If there are speed bumps or hiccups (which there always are) I will do me very best to communicate with you what is going on and how I plan to resolve any issues. One of the most important parts of being a creator and or a backer is to be flexible, as this IS a creative process and you are traveling along with me for the ride. Thank you for your support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

You will also receive one of each of the Standard Edition decks and also one of each of the hand engraved art prints of the Black & Gold Back design, Ace of Spades, King of Spades, Queen of Spades.
Only 1 of these editions will be made.
INCLUDES:
Blue Edition - Intaglio Playing Cards
Black Edition - Intaglio Playing Cards
Red Edition - Intaglio Playing Cards
Black Walnut & Maple Display Case
Ace of Spades Art Print
Back Design Art Print
Queen of Spades Art Print
King of Spades Art Print
Black & Gold - Gallery Edition Art Card Set
Back Design - Master Printing Plate

Hello everyone. I just wanted to give you guys a quick update on where we are in production. The has been an incredible learning process and I'm excited to say that the majority of the hard engraving is out of the way now. It took me a little longer than I expected but I have finished all of the court card line plates and am now moving on to the index or number cards. The plates are all turning out really great. I know there has been some silence the past few months but that is only because nothing has really changed, the engraving process takes so long that all other production just really "waits in line" as everything depends on the engraved plates.

campaign.story:
Update: SOLID SILVER COINS are now unlocked!! See 'Add-ons' below.
 Select 24K Gold Plated coins now available! See 'Add-ons' below.
What are Hobo Coins?
Throughout time, people have modified coins by hand-carving or engraving their own designs into existing coins. But this form of folk art really took off during the Great Depression. Those that were out of work or down on their luck took to modifying coins by engraving their own designs into them. They would use pocket knives or even filed down nails to carve beautiful designs that were as varied as the artists themselves. Often, these coins would portray skeletons or skulls, incorporating elements from the coins as part of their final works of art. They would almost always keep the lettering on the coins.
The Hobo Coins project brings back this largely forgotten piece of American history. These coins are being minted by the oldest continuously operated private mint in the U.S. and are SOLID. They each weigh about the same as 5 US. quarters, and are a little larger than the size of a US Dollar coins (these coins are 39 mm). Die-struck with over 100 tons of pressure in solid metal alloys and featuring antique finishes. Please note that Hobo Coins are not actual US currency or modified US currency coins, they are die-struck new coins at different sizes, weights, and (clearly), different art than actual US coins.
Help revive a piece of history you can carry!
The Designs
Each coin was crafted and designed by me using some of the most iconic coins as their base:
The ‘R.I.P.’ - 1922 Peace Dollar
Arguably the most beautiful coin ever produced, the U.S. Peace Dollar was originally produced to commemorate the peace that followed World War One. My rendition features a skull portrait (keeping the radiant crown) on the front (obverse), and two skeletal hands breaking a rifle on the back (reverse). Interesting to note that the ‘broken rifle’ was abstracted into the Peace Symbol we know today. Rest in Peace! Aged with an antique silver-finish. As with all the coins, this is a 39mm die-struck, hefty 12 gauge coin. Also, this coin will have a 'reeded' edge like the original Peace Dollar.
The 'R.I.P. Dollar - actual coin finish may vary.
The ‘Bad Mojo’ - 1936 Buffalo Nickel
My take on the classic Buffalo Nickel hobo coin (popular because it was a ‘soft’ coin to carve), features a skeleton Chief with a no-nonsense attitude on the front, and an intricately carved buffalo skeleton on the back. Aged with an antique silver-finish. As with all the coins, this is a 39mm die-struck, hefty 12 gauge coin. This coin will have a 'flat' edge like the original Buffalo Nickel.
The 'Bad Mojo' - actual coin finish may vary.
The ‘Walking Reaper’ - 1936 Walking Liberty Half Dollar
Scares the sh*t outta me—and that’s a good thing! Based on what is considered one the most beautiful coins of all time, the Walking Liberty Half Dollar. Front side (obverse) features a grim reaper you never want to meet, and the back of the coin shows a Poe-esque scene with a raven. Nevermore! Aged with an antique silver-finish. As with all the coins, this is a 39mm die-struck, hefty 12 gauge coin. This coin will have a 'reeded' edge like the original Walking Liberty Half Dollar.
The 'Walking Reaper' - actual coin finish may vary.
The ‘Old Hobo’ - 1891 Morgan Dollar
Even hobos like a drink! The front face (obverse) of the coin features a hobo skeleton enjoying a pint. The back side (reverse) shows a skeleton hobo chilling in a box car with his loyal dog companion. Aged with an antique silver-finish. As with all the coins, this is a 39mm die-struck, hefty 12 gauge coin. This coin will have a 'reeded' edge like the original Morgan Dollar.
The 'Old Hobo' - actual coin finish may vary.
The ‘Hobo Coin / Hobo Signs’ Limited Edition Print
To compliment the coins, I’ve designed this print which features a hobo walking through a shanty town along railroad tracks carrying a gunny sack, and is emblazoned with 'Liberty' at the top. Each print is 18” x 24”, signed, and numbered.
'Liberty' - inspired by coin typography and hobo coin art, each 18" x 24" print will be signed and numbered.
Add-ons
Additional coins or posters can be added to any base pledge as needed. Simply click on ‘Manage My Pledge’ and manually increase your pledge amount by the following:
Coins - add $14 (in the US), 15$ (international) to your pledge amount per additional coin, feel free to add as many as you would like. After the project closes you’ll be able to specify which design(s) you’d like.
Limited Edition Prints - add $40 (in the US), $46 (international) to your pledge amount per print.
Solid Silver Coins - add $60 ($65 international) to your pledge amount per solid silver coin. These coins are one troy ounce of solid .999 fine silver and will come with a Certificate of Authenticity card that is signed and numbered. The final quantity will be determined by the number ordered, feel free to add as many as you'd like. 
To add items to your pledge: Manually increase your pledge amount by the cost of the add-on items. After the project closes, I'll send you a link to make your final selections. For now, just click "Manage My Pledge" and add on the amount of your coin or print add-ons.
Here's a quick video on how to do this: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ak8SWlMeIoo&app=desktop
And here are some pictures of the coins:
One Troy Ounce Solid Fine Silver Coins (.999)
  Back of the solid silver RIP
  One Troy Ounce Solid Fine Silver Coins (.999)
  Back of the solid silver Bad Mojo
  One Troy Ounce Solid Fine Silver Coins (.999)
  Back of the solid silver Walking Reaper
  One Troy Ounce Solid Fine Silver Coins (.999)
  Back of the solid silver Old Hobo
Select 24K Gold Plated Coins add $25 ($30 international) to your pledge amount per selective plated coin. These coins are nickel silver coins that are selectively plated with 24K gold. Same size and weight as all the other coins; please note that the base coin is not solid silver but is actually a nickel silver alloy. 
              Four Coin Display - add $15 ($20 international) to your pledge amount per display (each display hold four coins). A great way to show off your coins! Comprised of 3 acrylic panes with embedded magnets, this is a simple, elegant, and easy to open and close system for displaying Hobo Coins. 
Acrylic Hobo Coin Display
  3 panel system with embedded magnets for easy opening and closing.
Stretch Goals
Funded to $10,000 - UNLOCKED!!!!
Antique Bronze versions of all coins. You can now select Antique Bronze coins for any of the coins you've backed for, or add these coins to your existing pledge. You'll be able to select which coin finish you want for all your coins after the project closes.
Antique Bronze Stretch Goal Coins
Funded to $15,000 - UNLOCKED!!!! 
Antique Solid Copper versions of all coins. You can now select Antique Copper coins for any of the coins you've backed for, or add these coins to your existing pledge. You'll be able to select which coin finish you want for all your coins after the project closes.
Antique Copper Stretch Goal Coins
Funded to $20,000 - UNLOCKED!!!! 
Antique Brass-Plated Steel (works with magnets! These are actually a shade thinner than the other coins - 10 gauge, that's the only option available from the mint). You can now select Brass-Plated Steel coins for any of the coins you've backed for, or add these coins to your existing pledge. You'll be able to select which coin finish you want for all your coins after the project closes.
Antique Brass Plated Steel Stretch Goal Coins

Solid Silver Coins - UNLOCKED!!!!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've created 3 fairly successful Kickstarter campaigns in the past - so I know there are always curveballs that challenge the best of plans. However, I feel super confident about this project. I've worked with the company who's making the coins and know their turnaround time, I've shipped thousands of coins to every corner of the world and know the complexities involved, and I've made good on every project in the past. My biggest watchouts for Hobo Coins are the finishes (gotta get that right), and the shipping timeframe. I put the estimated delivery as two months after the project closes and that's about right. If the project gets big (I should be so lucky), that might push out the delivery a little, but not much.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
WELCOME TO TORTUGA!
The year is 1667 and you are a pirate sailing the waters of the Caribbean. A Spanish Galleon floats nearby, and you’ve talked your crewmates into working together to steal all of its treasure. What you haven’t told your fellow pirates is that you have no intentions on sharing the treasure once you have it. Your crewmates have told you that they share your loyalty and that they’ll help you maroon the greedy pirates on your ship to the rocky island of Tortuga. But you’ve seen your friends’ loaded pistols and heard their whisperings of a mutiny. You know that nobody can be trusted.
For 2-9 Players. 20-40 minutes. Ages 12+.
  GAME CONTENTS
1 Faux book container
1 Rulebook (includes character biographies)
64 Cards (9 Brethren of the Coast, 16 Event, 30 Vote, 9 Loyalty)
1 Rubber playing mat
1 Burlap pouch
9 Wooden pawns
8 Wooden treasure chests
THE GAME
The game is packaged in a faux book box. The box has 3 magnets to keep it closed when you're moving it to and from game night.
  The game fits nicely inside the faux book box. The box is big enough for cards to be sleeved, if desired.
  The game board is a rubber playmat. The board rolls up like a map.
  The 8 wooden treasure pieces come in a burlap bag.
  Each of the 9 wooden pawns matches with 1 of the 9 pirates you can be in the game. Each pirate is based on a real pirate who roamed Tortuga and the Caribbean seas in the year 1667.
     Each player has a secret loyalty: British, Dutch, or French. But be careful who you trust; someone claiming to share your loyalty may stab you in the back and steal your hard-earned treasure.
  Use Event cards during the game to help your team get treasure, or to maroon members of the opposite team to the island of Tortuga.
  Use Vote cards during the game to secretly impact Attacks against the Spanish, Mutinies against your Captain, and Brawls against your fellow pirates.
REWARDS
We're not big into confusing reward levels or expensive add-ons. We want each of our backers to get the best reward we can offer: this beautiful game! We splurged on a few items that we felt really added to the game quality (the rubber playmat, faux book, burlap bag, wooden treasures), while still keeping the overall costs low and eliminating unnecessary pieces. We're proud to give our Kickstarter backers the best price that this game will ever see.
$1-$9 Thank you for your support!
$10 An emailed PDF of the cards & board, ready for printing
$23 Tortuga 1667 
$44 Tortuga 1667 x2 
$63 Tortuga 1667 x3 
$80 Tortuga 1667 x4 
$100 "Make 100" Kickstarter special. Includes Tortuga 1667 x2, plus our illustrator will turn any person you'd like (perhaps you or a friend) into a pirate. We'll send you 2 custom "Brethren of the Coast" cards of this pirate that you can use interchangeably in the game. 
$150+ Tortuga 1667 x4 + Special Mention in the back of the rulebook + Print and Play version of the game. Thank you for your extra support! 
$175 Tortuga 1667 x10
$250 Retailer Discount: 20 Copies of the Game. You must message us with proof that you're an established retailer of some kind for this reward. (Only available in the US, UK, & EU)
Shipping: We are using fulfillment companies around the world to make shipping costs as cheap as possible for our backers. For our European and UK backers we will be shipping from within the EU so that you do not have to pay any customs charges. 
TESTIMONIALS
I don’t trust my friends anymore. But I love this game. -Tessa
Tortuga is a game full of surprises! Each round brings with it new and intriguing events that ultimately make you the master of the sea or scum of Tortuga. It all depends on how proficient you are at finding your team and making that knowledge count. -Alex R.
I have played this game basically every week for the last couple of months. I have loved it every single time and never been bored. It’s a great game to play with friends and really makes you think. -Abigail S
I love this game!!! No game is ever the same, and it's always exciting. You never know who is going to do what or if you are trusting the right person. Everyone I have introduced to this game has loved it too. -Alex W.
Tortuga is a great social deduction game and it looks great on your game shelf too! Love the game even though sometimes it makes me question my friends and family. -Brett A.
A game where I can deceive and be called Captain is a very good game indeed." -Derek H.
Tortuga is unique in the fact that it allows the perfect amount of deception for those that enjoy tricking and deceiving others, but it also provides the opportunity to work off of pure logic and reason for the other players that do not particularly excel in manipulation. I have had the opportunity of playing this game numerous times with many different crowds, and every game is completely different because of the different strategies and techniques that people can utilize. -Levi H.
PRESS
Dice Tower News: http://www.dicetowernews.com/facade-games-welcomes-you-to-tortuga-1667-on-kickstarter/35996
Geek & Sundry: http://geekandsundry.com/tortuga-1667-kickstarter-brings-treacherous-pirates-to-tabletop-gaming/
Cwowd.com (French): http://www.cwowd.com/tortuga-cap-sur-bonne-esperance/
Beasts of War: http://www.beastsofwar.com/tortuga-1667/command-ship-secure-treasure-tortuga-1667-ks/ 
Viva Veltoro: http://www.vivaveltoro.com/2017/02/tortuga-1667-pirate-game.html
Tabletop Gaming: https://www.tabletopgaming.co.uk/board-games/news/tortuga-1667-is-a-gorgeous-social-deception-game-with-pirates 
DDO Players: http://ddoplayers.com/2017/01/22/tortuga-1667-a-pirate-game-on-kickstarter/
Club Fantasci: http://www.clubfantasci.com/kickstarter-week-tortuga-1667/
Board Game Stories: http://boardgamestories.com/news/party/no-pirate-trusted-tortuga-1667/
If you have an article about Tortuga 1667 or this project, please message us so we can have it featured here. We're also happy to answer any questions you have for the articles. Thanks!
RULES OVERVIEW
PLAY

  Note: The video above gives a brief overview of the gameplay and rules. Complete rules, including tips & tricks, rule clarifications, advanced optional rules, event card descriptions, and character biographies are not shown in the video, but are all included in the game rulebook. If you'd like to look at the complete rules now please visit the links below: 
English 
French
German
Spanish 
Dutch
Italian
Portuguese
Hungarian
Turkish
Play the game as 1 of these 9 actual pirates from history. Biographies of each pirate are in the back of the rulebook.
  Each player has a secret loyalty card. This is your team. Part of the game is deciphering who is your teammate and who is your enemy.
  The Tortuga playing board. Teams win if they have the most treasure in their team's treasure holds when the Spanish Armada card is revealed.
  Players choose to perform one action on their turn. One potential action is to reveal one of five available Event cards.
  Be careful about which Event cards you reveal! Some may maroon you or your teammates to Tortuga.
  If you reveal one of the three treasure maps, you must give it to someone you trust. If you reveal the Spanish Armada, the game is over.
  During the game, Captains can call for Attacks, First Mates can call for Mutinies, and the Governor of Tortuga can call for Brawls. When one of these votes is called for, use your Vote cards to secretly cast your vote!
  Depending on the player count, you'll need to rely more heavily on certain skills to win the game. We love the flexibility and variability of Tortuga 1667 based on the player count!
TORTUGA CREATION PROCESS
A great game (in our opinion), needs three things: solid mechanics, an awesome theme, and beautiful design.
1. Mechanics
Tortuga is all about the interactions you have with the other players. In some cases, such as when you and your shipmates are attacking the Spanish Galleon, you need to rely on your enemies in order to succeed. In the very next turn, however, your shipmates might stab you in the back with a mutiny in order to keep all the treasure for themselves.
Since nobody holds a "hand" of cards, this game is also about knowledge and communication regarding the community Event cards. Unless you are in desperation mode, it is not wise to reveal Event cards at random. Almost half of the Event cards can hurt your team drastically. It's often in your best interest to use an action to view the cards first, or to rely on the knowledge of a trusted ally. Knowing where harmful Event cards are located allows you to force an enemy to reveal those cards and suffer the consequences. The most successful players are the ones who are able to discern who is on their team and then share vital information with them at opportune moments.
Vote cards also play a key role in the game. Each Vote card has three sections - one each for Attacks, Mutinies, and Brawls. Players must put themselves in the best position to use their Vote cards, since their hand of Vote cards may not always be ideal based on their pawn location. For example, sometimes it may be worth putting in Water, causing an attack to fail, in order to save a Crossbones card for when you want to Mutiny against your captain.
A game in progress.
  2. Theme
Tortuga, a small island off of Haiti, was an important pirate settlement and hideout during the golden age of piracy. British, French, and Dutch pirates lived together on the island in a loose alliance and formed a pirate government known as “The Brethren of the Coast.” Rich from its support of piracy and protected by the Brethren, Tortuga was full of taverns, gambling houses, and prostitutes.
The French and British governments, in an attempt to weaken the mighty Spanish, would often legalize piracy by giving pirates letters of marque. These gave pirates permission to unofficially plunder Spanish ships and towns. Many of the pirates on Tortuga chose the privateering life over full-blown piracy, which was illegal. Loyalty to country was fleeting, though, and pirates often walked the line between patriotism and rebellion.
Tortuga 1667 aims to capture the atmosphere of these loose alliances and shifting political loyalties.
All parts of the game were designed to bring the players into the canvas, wooden planks, and golden treasure world of the 1667 pirates!
3. Design
The illustrations from Sarah Keele and graphic design from Holly Hancock take players deep into the world of privateers and pirate life. We used textures consistent to what pirates would see on an everyday basis: wooden planks and tables, canvas sails, and weather-torn maps.
All pieces of the game were carefully chosen for their color and aesthetic contributions to the theme. The burlap bag conjures images of a pirate's bag of possessions. Many of the cards use a canvas background like the sails on a ship. The playmat rolls out and looks just like an old treasure map. The faux book is worn and colored a piratey brown, dark maroon, and black.
Some of Sarah's initial sketches and process for creating the beautiful illustrations in the game.
STRETCH GOALS
Because we've reached the following milestones, we will be adding 8 "game-changer" cards to every copy of the game! When setting up, players will add 3 of these game-changers into the Event deck. These cards have the potential to turn the tide in your team's favor! Cards will now also all be given a high-quality linen finish, 2 and 3-player setup rules will be added to the rulebook, a "Captain's Helm" illustration will be added to the blank Mutiny sections on the Vote cards, 2 "double-vote" Vote cards will be added to each copy of the game, a wooden explosion token will be added to each copy of the game, Brethren of the Coast cards will have player action lists on the back of them, the Treasure map will include a compass rose and map legend, and we're adding a Quick-Start/Certified First Edition card to every copy of the game!
  WHY KICKSTARTER?
If we reach our goal, we will be able to pay for the manufacturing and shipping of the first edition of Tortuga 1667. We already have our manufacturers lined up and ready to go! As you can see from our photos, samples of the game have already been produced and designs are complete. We just need to raise the funds and say go!
We fell in love with the Kickstarter community when we launched our last game, Salem. The feedback, support, trust, and positivity from the community was incredible. We're proud to reward our Kickstarter backers with discounts on the game, first-in-line knowledge and insight into the project, and a direct line of communication to us as the creators. We consider each Kickstarter backer to be a close ally in our game-making endeavors.
THE DARK CITIES SERIES
Tortuga 1667 is Volume 1 in Facade Games' Dark Cities Series! Each game in the series will:
Be packaged in a faux book. 
Focus on a particular city and year. 
Include a dark, mysterious, or deceptive element in its gameplay. 
Accommodate at least 4-9 players. 
We know your game closet is a mess. Start your bookshelf collection of games with Dark Cities Volume 1: Tortuga 1667!
PAST PROJECTS
In April 2015 we raised $103,000 on Kickstarter with our first game, Salem. This game takes players into the dark world of the Salem Witch Trials. Players must hunt down the witches before becoming one! The game has now sold over 10,000 copies and is played around the world. 

We are extremely proud to have delivered Salem on time to our backers! Here's what one of our backers had to say: 

I have backed over 46 projects and I just wanted to say this project has been an absolute delight to have been a backer for. Your updates have been insightful, but not overbearing. You clearly put a lot of time, thought, and effort into this game and it really shows. I was impressed with how fast this project came together. It was a fast, well organized campaign. Kudos to you and thank you for a wonderful end product. I couldn't be happier. -Snuffles00

Salem's Kickstarter Page
Salem's Store Page
Salem's Amazon Page (check out the reviews!)

We've made Salem available as an "Add-on" reward for this Kickstarter campaign. If you add $25 to your pledge, we'll send you Salem inside the Tortuga 1667 package sent out in August. See the FAQ section for details. 

THE CREATORS
Game creation and graphic design is by Facade Games, owned and operated by Travis and Holly Hancock. Learn more at www.facadegames.com, or follow us on facebook, instagram, or twitter.
Illustrations were drawn by Sarah Keele. Follow her beautiful artwork on instagram.
A huge thank you to the hundreds of hours put in by our many play-testers!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We will do everything in our power to achieve on-time delivery, and we will reach out concerning any unforeseen circumstances. Currently our manufacturers are lined up and just waiting for the green light once we are funded. Our first project, Salem, was delivered on time to backers as promised. Please never hesitate to message us directly with comments, concerns, or suggestions.

Thank you for making this exciting project possible!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Bristol 1350 joins Tortuga 1667 in the Dark Cities Series!
updates.update_content:
Tortuga 1667 Backers and Friends,
It has been over two years since we last updated you. Some of you may already be aware, but we wanted to let you know that a couple weeks ago we launched the next volume in the Dark Cities Series on Kickstarter! It is called Bristol 1350.

updates.update_userinfo: Tortuga 1667 Nominated as Best Party Game of 2017!
updates.update_content:
Backers and Friends,
The largest online board game community, Board Game Geek, has nominated Tortuga as the best party game of 2017! Thank you for playing and loving this game and making this nomination possible. If you are an active member of BGG you can cast your vote before tomorrow night at this link: BGG Golden Geek Awards

updates.update_userinfo: Our new game just went live on Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Backers and Friends,
Deadwood 1876 just went live on Kickstarter! You are the very first people to know. Here are some pictures of the game:

updates.update_userinfo: The Next Dark Cities Game Launching Soon!
updates.update_content:
Backers and Friends,
You are the very first people to know that we will be launching our next game in the Dark Cities Series on Kickstarter on February 20th! Facade Games is headed to the old west!

Backers and Friends,
It has been so rewarding to hear about your first experiences with Tortuga 1667! Thank you for your kind words and reviews. We put a lot of love into this game, and it feels amazing to see so many of you enjoying it! We hope that you'll maroon and plunder with your friends and family for a long time.

Backers and Friends,
We have started shipping Tortuga 1667!
Here are some things to keep in mind as you wait for your order to ship:
1. You will get an email when your game ships. Most of the games will also have tracking available, but regardless of if they have tracking or not you'll still get an email when the game initially ships.

Backers and Friends,
We're getting closer! The USA games have arrived to our fulfillment center, and the Germany and UK games should get to our EU/World fulfillment centers very soon. Right now the plan is to finalize everything and begin shipping all of the games on August 14th! Since there are so many orders, our centers will be shipping out games until around August 25th. We'll do our best to get all the games out towards the beginning of that timeline, but we're also grateful for your patience if you don't get your copy til later in the month.

Backers and Friends,
We're getting closer! We'll be locking down your shipping addresses on August 3rd, so if you have recently moved or need to make any adjustments to your order, now is the time to do it. Just re-open your survey using this link: https://app.crowdox.com/retrieve/travishancock/tortuga-1667-a-pirate-game-of-mutiny-plunder-and-d

Backers and Friends,
The pirates of Tortuga 1667 are feeling right at home as they cross the ocean! We're currently boating the games to our fulfillment partners around the world. After they arrive, we'll send the games to you!
There have been some delays in the Shanghai port so the boat left a little later than we'd have liked, but we're still doing everything we can to reach the August delivery deadline. Since travel time on the boats can also be somewhat unpredictable, we'll be sure to keep you posted. It's usually 6-8 weeks to get shipping containers moved and through customs.

Backers and Friends,
Just wanted to give you a quick update. Production is still on schedule for Tortuga 1667 to be manufactured by May 29th. After that the games will take 6-8 weeks to reach us, and then we'll ship them out to you!
Here's a picture of the final map sent straight from our factory:

campaign.story:
Arcade Lancaster was born out of a desire to play classic arcade games and kick it old school with friends. This exciting nostalgia bar is planned for a top secret location in downtown Lancaster and just needs a little nudge to make it happen.
With your support Arcade Lancaster plans to open with 12-15 arcade machines and two-three classic console lounges. There will be plenty of craft brews and nerdy-mixed drinks concoted by a level-9 potion mage. There will be a steady supply of entertainment including live music, 80’s dance parties, comedy and maybe even some Video Armagedon.
In exchange for your support we have some incredible loot lined up for our backers.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have two main challenges:

1.) Game Selection – With our existing collection of ten arcade machines and current budget we know that we can open with 12-15 games. The more money we are able to raise the more choice titles we will be able to guarantee. 

2.) Timeline – We intend to open in 2016 which means we are moving very fast. Our location is secured and requires only minor updates (fresh paint, new furniture and a few extra outlets). While the timeline is aggressive we have an eager team driving us forward.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Opening night is finally upon us. The transformation of the Lizard Lounge has reached it's tipping point and we're ready for the future. We can't wait to share it with all of you. We've come a long way and we're only going to keep making improvements. This will be our final update to the Kickstarter and there are a bunch of updates to make!
Backer Rewards
PLAY

We've got our goal! Thanks to everyone who contributed. We're so excited for what's to come. We're planning to shoot and release an update video on Sunday revealing our location. Though that's not going to stop us from letting our backers know right away.
Arcade Lancaster is coming to the Lizard Lounge. For those of you that don't know the Lizard Lounge is located on the ground floor of the Chameleon. Justin and I approached the Club in early August about transforming the lounge into an Arcade Bar. If we could bring in the games they agreed to help us fulfill the vision. Now that we're funded we can hold up our end by securing all the games needed and put in place some much needed changes to ensure that this is a place we all want to hang out at.

We're so close! We can almost taste those delicious beers and hear the dinging and donging of arcade machines. We're going to be revealing a new game on FB this week and we've also dropped the cost on the "Wall of Hero's" reward to $175. The Wall of Hero's will be a permanent mural in the bar featuring the 8-bit likenesses of the founding team and supporters. It also happens to include a lot of additional loot too, so check it out!
As always, drop us a few likes or shares on Facebook or Twitter, it goes a long way. Thanks everyone for your support so far. We can't wait to announce the location and get to work redecorating the place!

<3

campaign.story:
THE FOURTH COLLECTION!
This is Fire & Bone's fourth collection. With the addition of these eight amazing new species we now carry more than 35 different animal skulls! You can see and purchase all of our previous collections here.
MINIATURE SKULLS DIRECT FROM NATURE
Fire & Bone makes tiny, true-to-life, animal skull reproductions derived from high-resolution 3D scans of original specimens, carefully miniaturized in a digital process, then cast in metal using traditional techniques. Each skull can be worn or displayed on their optional wood collectors base.
This is our fourth Kickstarter collection and we’re adding eight new species, including several of the animals that are most frequently requested by our backers. We’re also introducing an amazing new way to collect and display our incredibly detailed skulls and we've got two great new non-skull (!) pendants.
Like us, our incredible backers are passionate naturalists, miniature collectors, and animal lovers and we hope you get as big a kick at seeing and holding these tiny new skulls as we do.
THE NEW COLLECTION 
EIGHT NEW SPECIES!
DEER ANTLER & COYOTE CLAW PENDANTS!
This collection contains some of the most frequently backer-requested animals and we’re very excited to finally add them our collection: The White-Tailed Deer, with its awesome antlers, and the American Alligator, Wolverine, and Coyote, each with articulated jaws.
AMERICAN ALLIGATOR with ARTICULATED JAW
The clever Raccoon, the stoic Musk Ox, the wily Goat, and the elegant Sacred Ibis round out the collection.
DEER ANTLER & COYOTE CLAW PENDANTS!
We’re expanding our product range with two new necklaces; a White-Tailed Deer ANTLER and a Coyote CLAW. Both were produced using the same high-resolution process as our skulls and they possess the same level of natural detail.
NEW DESKTOP DISPLAY SKULLS!
For the first time ever, we’re turning the WOLVERINE, the MERINO RAM, and the GRAY WOLF into larger 3D printed display skulls that will make an incredible addition to any home museum. They measure about THREE INCHES in length and are available in bleached bone WHITE or matte BLACK.
3D SCANNING & MINIATURIZATION
Our process begins by digitally scanning real animal skulls. We work with a company that uses a proprietary 3D scanning process to digitally capture animal skulls in very high detail. We are thrilled with the level of detail we get from this method, which isn't possible with consumer-level 3D scanners. 
We scale the piece down to a size suitable for collection or jewelry. Because we do this digitally and not manually, we retain an unprecedented amount of detail from the original skull. 
To make the final pieces, we reproduce the miniature model in wax with a professional level high-resolution 3D printer. With our wax model we make a master mold which allows us to cast the skulls in any metal using traditional lost-wax casting. We work with a family owned foundry in the U.S. with decades of experience producing large production runs of small delicate pieces.
REWARDS
***If you'd like to pledge for multiple reward tiers, simply add up the total amount to cover each reward that you would like (be sure to add the appropriate shipping amount if it is an international order). Then, pledge the total amount, select just one reward, and contact us to let us know which additional rewards you are pledging for. We’ll keep track on our end and make sure you get everything you would like!***
FIRE & BONE AND KICKSTARTER
In putting together this fourth collection, we recognized what an amazing community Kickstarter has been for us. We get to test demand for new skulls, and we have a great platform for communicating with fans. If this campaign is successful, we will be able to keep acquiring more hard-to-get skulls for our collection and building this project together with you.
If you missed our previous campaigns, those collections are now available on our site - www.fireandbone.com. We now have over 35 species, and we're excited to continue to add more!
Skulls from previous campaigns available at www.fireandbone.com
 Even though we have made some great steps since we first launched – we now sell Fire & Bone through a couple world famous science museums, which is mind-blowingly cool – we are still primarily three guys who do this as a passion. Kickstarter lets us find people who share that passion.
TESTIMONIALS
Here are a few of the nice things people have said about our tiny animal skulls:
• "My bear skull with the cool articulated jaw just arrived! Exquisite! One of my favorite Kickstarter projects so far." - Nancy J.
• "Just got my Roe Deer and Black Bear in the mail...you guys have absolutely outdone yourselves! They exceeded all of my expectations - I cannot wait to wear such an interesting piece of jewelry. Anyone who's looking around and thinking about buying any of Fire & Bone's pieces, go for it! You will not be disappointed!" - Jennifer C.
• "I received my skulls and I just wanted to say that I'm still impressed every time I look at them. The quality is commendable - for something so small, the detail is incredible. They make a wonderful talking-piece displayed on the little stands I received with them." - Jake D.
• "My sabertooth cat arrived today. Completely, absolutely unequivocally love love love it & the fact it's from a real skull just makes it incredibly special! Thank you so much!" - Rebecca M.
• "These are gorgeous and unique pieces. I got my girlfriend a bear's skull from the first run and she absolutely loved it. I highly recommend this great project." - Gian D.
• "Just wanted to say how amazing my jaguar skull is! Thank you!" - Emma L.
• "If anyone here doesn't have one of these. Get one! They are amazing. Thank you so much for the Dire Wolf. I can't wait to be able to order more." - Alex K.
• "Have it. Love it! I wear it all the time and always get compliments on it." - Acacia S.
• "I’ve got their lion, grey wolf, and a gemsbok from their last KickStarter. They’re beautiful pieces." - @canisdemachina
• I have the croc and the jaguar and they are both incredibly beautiful! I'm in love! - @fancyunicornparty
THANKS!
We couldn't do this without you. Let us know what you think in the comments, and keep those skull suggestions coming!
-Jason, Chris, & Matt (and Taco)
(Our thanks to our friends at LAUNCHPACK for their help with this campaign!)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There can be production challenges associated with any manufacturing project (delays, equipment failure, theft, etc.), but we've been through this before and have a lot of confidence in our ability to fulfill this campaign in a timely fashion. We have built a strong working relationship with our foundry and are supremely confident in their ability to meet any level of demand.

Another unique challenge for us is that molds wear out over time. We have a lot of experience in jewelry design and metal casting, and we know how to plan for this.

As many people have discovered, 3D scanning, design, and printing all require expertise. We are veteran users of these technologies and have worked in many high-stress situations to develop great products. Fire & Bone is not just a passion for us, it’s totally in our wheelhouse.

Last, it's important to bear in mind the difficulty of getting access to more specimens for future castings - we definitely need your help to have a chance to scan more of these specimens.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Magnetips are not your average fine-liners. As well as being refillable, each one of our Patent-Pending pens also contains two super strong Neodymium magnets. This means that they attract one another (or any metal surface), becoming the centre-piece of your desktop. Colouring is only the beginning!
 We noticed that when unused, most of our favourite colouring pens just added to our desk clutter. When finished, they become useless, resulting in a large amount of waste added to our garbage pile. 
 So…we set down at Typica and thought how we could do better. We ended up designing a beautiful and refillable set of pens that not only writes and colours beautifully, but also helps to reduce waste.
But we didn't stop there. By adding two super strong Neodymium magnets to each of our pens, we gave the pens a life of their own, making each set into an object in its own right, both useful and playful in countless ways, even beyond colouring, sketching, and writing.
Over the past year we fine-tuned every aspect of the design. Quality, and Simplicity have been our top priorities. Right from the start, we aimed to make the best pens at the best price.
Magnetips Are:
Refillable: reusable pens with easy to replace quality fine-line refills.
Comfortable: wide ergonomic hex shape makes long hours of gripping easy on the hand. 
Water based : Water based ink is Healthier (and smells better too).
Accurate: Metal encased fine-line quality 0.4 nib. 
Magnetic: life-long lasting rare-earth Neodymium magnets inside. 
Safe :Incorporated air-flow vents. These makes our pens safer and child-friendly. 
Long Lasting: Durable and strong Polypropylene body.
The principles behind the design of this set are innovative yet simple and reliable, allowing adults and children to enjoy writing and playing safely in countless new ways.
We would love MAGNETIPS to be the centre-piece of your desk. That’s why we have designed two sets: "Black Edition" and "Colour Edition", both of which contain all of our 20 colour refills. 
Black Edition
Colour Edition
Black Edition
Colour Edition
The sets are of equal quality and dimensions, so the pens from both will attract to one another. You can even play around and change caps between the two editions.
We have put a lot of thought into choosing our favourite tones, making sure they will all fit together beautifully and be worthy of our fine-line refills. We are quite proud of the result, and we are sure you will love them too.
MAGNETIPS Colour Palette
Each set of MAGNETIPS comes pre-loaded with a full set of 20 colour refills. Once these are finished, you don't have to throw your pens away, but simply reload them with a new refill set.
Quality 0.4 Fine Line Fibre Tip
Used up your Gum-Pink in a week? No problem! You don’t have to replace the entire set of pens or even the pen itself. Simply replace the refill in the pen that has run out.
Refill replacement is a breeze. The parts open with a good snap. Just take out the empty refill, replace it with a new one, and snap it shut again. It's that simple!
Besides keeping them in neat order on your desk, the strong magnets inside the pens open up endless possibilities for playfulness and creativity.
Hold Your Favourite Photos
The Strong Magnets Allow Drawing In New ways
They Will Strongly Attach To Most Metal Surfaces
Take Them With You
Keep then In/Out Of Your Pocket
While playing with our creation, we soon discovered that adding metal balls opens up a whole new world of possibilities for structures and fun that will help de-stress even your roughest day at the office. It worked for us! This is why we decided to offer them along with our pens (check the Add-On menu below the rewards).
Twist It
Stand It
Roll It
Love It
The balls will be made to our specifications. They are made of chrome-plated steel, and they will not rust or tarnish for a very long time. They are not magnetic on their own (which makes them much safer) but “ferromagnetic,” which means they will strongly attract our pens and any other magnet.
Prices shown in USD and EURO are approximate conversions from GBP. 
All pledges are for either the "Colour Edition" or "Black Edition"or both- Once the project ends, we will send you a "Backer Survey" to verify exactly what you pledged for.
          If you pledged over £1 you can add any combination of Add-Ons to your pledge. Simply add the price of the Add-Ons you want to your final pledge amount. After the campaign ends, we will contact each backer to verify the items pledged for.
                                    Let’s take a closer look at the details of our pens:
The structure is divided into three main parts: pen barrel (body), barrel cap, and lid. The magnets are mechanically locked inside, so cannot come out accidentally.
We kept the number of parts to a minimum. Simple and reliable.
General Dimensions
In each pen, we will be using two super strong axially magnetised rare-Earth magnets.
Neodymium magnets are the strongest and most permanent magnets known. Typically they will only lose less than 1% of their strength over 10 years: not enough for you to notice unless you have very sensitive measuring equipment. They won't even lose their strength if they are held in repelling or attracting positions with other magnets over long periods of time.
The magnet in the pen lid and the magnet in the pen body are fixed in opposite polarities. This ensures the lid will always be attracted to the pen body. .
In the GIF above we have played around with a magnetic field detecting sheet (yes, they exist!). It clearly shows the strong magnetic field when placed over the pens.
Everything is almost ready, but we do need your help to make Magnetips available for everyone. We can only afford to offer our pens at low prices by placing a large initial production order. By making a pledge to our project, you will enable us to order the best tools and commit to the manufacturers minimum order quantities, for both the pens and the refills. We would love to be able to do this ourselves, but the upfront costs are unrealistic for our small team. Every little bit will go toward making this product a reality, something that everyone can enjoy.
Thank you for your support!
                                                                            Interested in featuring our story? in this LINK you will find everything you need, including a press release and High Res. images. Missing something? Just mail us at press@magnetips.co
A special thanks to "Mind The Film" for the great video, D2M for their help with DFM and sourcing, and the talented artists from "Blue Star Coloring Books" for their support.
 This project is promoted by Jellop, a direct­ response online advertising agency specializing in Kickstarter campaigns on Facebook Ads and Google AdWords.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Throughout the past year, we have been working around the clock refining our designs. Numerous prototypes have been developed, and countless hours have been spent making sure the pens will be as good as we intend them to be.

Manufacturing products in large scale is always a challenging operation. After extensive research, we have established a good relationship with a manufacturer that has many years of experiences in the field of writing instruments and is able to work to our exact specifications.  We intend to follow the production closely in order to ensure the quality of the end product.

Colour mixing is always a challenge, on a small or large scale. We have taken the time to experiment with different shades, coming up with our own unique selection. We will work closely with our manufacturer to stay as true as possible to the suggested colour scheme. Should there be any significant changes, these will be communicated to you, our backers.

Significant buffers have been included in our schedule to account for any issues that may arise, and we will keep you updated on any deviation from our original plan. We will be using a professional fulfilment company to handle the shipping logistics, to ensure that side of the operation is well covered.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Lunchtime: It’s the most difficult time of the day to control what you eat. 
Eating out, or getting takeout, can get costly — and it’s virtually impossible to know exactly what’s inside your food.
That's why we created the Prepd Pack, a revolutionary new take on the humble lunchbox.
From planning and preparing your lunches, to tracking your food’s nutritional value, Prepd Pack and its integrative app makes the entire process easier, more enjoyable, and less wasteful.
Beautifully designed, Prepd Pack is uncompromisingly modern, consisting of a main case that houses a versatile modular system of containers and smart magnetic cutlery.

The removable modular containers are central to Prepd’s functionality — corresponding to each day’s needs, these individual food compartments can be combined in multiple configurations within the Prepd Pack. Made from the highest-quality materials, the containers are food-safe and completely leak-proof.
Our immersive app makes prepping your lunches for the weeks ahead simple. We partnered with professional chefs and nutritionists to create an evolving library of recipes tailored to fit a broad range of diets, appetites, and health goals.
All available recipes are designed to fill the modular containers, perfectly — making meal prepping less complicated, and, by eliminating unwanted food waste, more efficient.
Get ready for a simpler and smarter grocery-shopping experience — our app will take care of organizing shopping lists, so you’ll know exactly what to buy the moment you get to the store.
The Prepd app will be available for both Android and iOS smartphones and tablets, and will be free for all backers.
Finding calorie counting difficult? Relax — the Prepd app does all the math for you. By filling your Prepd Pack (and tummy) with our mouthwatering recipes, you’ll gain instant access to precise and in-depth nutritional information.
All collected data is stored within the app, giving you meaningful on-demand feedback about your diet. The app will also connect with HealthKit on iOS, allowing you to conveniently navigate all your health and fitness information in one place.
The app is filled with prep-friendly meal plans, making batch cooking extremely efficient — just imagine preparing a week’s worth of lunches in under an hour.  
Developed by experienced meal preppers, these original plans are delicious and ingeniously diverse, making your everyday meals exciting and uniquely different.
We've done the hard work, so you don't have to. Bon appétit!
The modular glass-clear containers nest perfectly atop one another, making fridge storage neat and (since you can plainly see what’s inside each container) insightful.
Have your lunch ready to go when you are — order multiple sets of containers and prep ahead for as many meals as you want. 
Save time for other things, like enjoying your morning coffee.
Joining the Prepd community lets you connect and share ideas with people who, like you, are passionate about food and health — a place to discover endless amounts of tips and tricks for prepping better lunches.
By creating your very own profile page, you’ll be able to browse the interactive library and save recipes to curate your own meal plans.
Homemade lunches are infinitely healthier — keeping both you and your wallet in better shape. With the Prepd Pack you can enjoy a delicious lunch and save money. *Spending values obtained from the 2015 Lunch Survey by Visa.
The ever-increasing amount of plastic packaging is exacerbating the environmental footprint. Unlike takeout, using the Prepd Pack is completely waste-free 
We don’t just talk the talk, we’re serious about sustainability. In an effort of tackling climate change, we’ve chosen to manufacture the Prepd Pack from high-quality recycled and eco-friendly materials.
Take part in the fight for our planet. Cut down on unnecessary food waste by preparing your own lunches and controlling exactly how much you consume
The Prepd Sleeve add-on will insulate your Prepd Pack with a layer of premium fabric-lined Neoprene (a flexible, heat- and wear-resistant material, used for making wetsuits) — providing extra protection and ensuring your food’s temperature stays consistent during longer commutes.
The Sleeve’s stylish strap also allows you to carry the Prepd Pack in one hand, effortlessly and securely. Personalize your Prepd Pack’s color, choose either Stone Grey, Charcoal Black, or Prepd Blue.
Freeze the cold packs overnight and clip them inside your Prepd Pack to keep your food cool and fresh for even longer. Seamless and unobtrusive, the cold packs easily dock along both sides of the Prepd Pack without taking up any usable space.
Though a labor of love, bringing Prepd to where it is today was a long and challenging journey. We’re already in the final stages of development, but we now need your help to bring Prepd fully to life.
The money raised on Kickstarter will go directly toward the final tooling, first production run, and completion of the app
Years in the making, and leaving no stone unturned, we have meticulously considered every functional and aesthetic detail of the Prepd Pack.
First Prototype
Together with knowledgable nutritionists and innovative meal preppers, we’ve created a solution that will put an end to all your hesitations about taking your homemade lunch to work
CMF and DFM process
Modern look, contemporary build — so you can trust that your food is sealed and secure, and that you look chic carrying it around.
Current Product
We are really excited about bringing the Prepd app to life. And not without reason — more than a simple recipe bank, the app will help you regain control over lunchtime, hit health goals, and stick to resolutions.
Our app’s UI design is clean, is easy-to-navigate, and is cross-device functional. Plan your meals on your iPad, then get your shopping lists on your iPhone — and Android devices too!
We are a team of award-winning designers and engineers united by a common goal of making healthy living easier and more enjoyable through good design.
Engadget / TechCrunch / SELF Magazine / Brit + Co / Core77 / Tech Insider / Inhabitat / Mental Floss / Mashable / Notable / Gear Hungry / Digital Trends / Startup Daily / Lovin Dubai / Tech In Asia / Slash Gear / Gizmag / PSFK / Design Taxi / International Business Times UK / Gadget Sin / Ubergizmo / e27 / Contemporist / Foodie / HiConsumption / Lovin Trends
Interested in writing about us? Our press kit is available for download here. Also, please feel free to email us directly at hello@getprepd.com or leave a message if you have any questions.

Risks and challenges
Production - Our team is experienced in both design and manufacturing and we have developed the product together with our trusted suppliers from day one. However, you won't settle for a mediocre product and neither will we, so we won't be compromising on quality in order to save time. Should any issues arise we promise to keep you updated every step of the way.

App Development - Part of our motivation for choosing Kickstarter was to gain feedback on your most desired features for the app. Although we have already completed our first prototype and outlined a plan for how the final app will function, additional time may be needed to develop additional features.

Growing our community of experts - We currently are working with a number of chefs, dietitians and nutritionists to help build and curate the content for the App. It's our goal to build a wide range of recipes and plans to suit everyone and we will be working hard to continually expand the variety by partnering with specialists in different areas.

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! We're working hard here in the studio to fulfill all the orders we received. 
Having so many pieces to ship out is a great problem! As you know we ran into some delays a few weeks ago, and are still moving past them to continue fulfillment. Backers who ordered decks or accessories alone will begin receiving their orders. Frame orders will take a bit more, as we are handcrafting each piece. We are moving as quickly as we can. We appreciate your patience, and are excited to get you your rewards. Thanks again!

Happy New Year...!
Didn't want to bombard you with the campaign till after the Holidays. Hope your Holidays were joyful.
We will send an email with a special link to BackerKit surveys this week. It is important to respond to your survey as quickly as you can since we need this information for fulfilling your rewards.

You are now owners of an original Dale Mathis fine art piece. I thank you for your pledge.
By now your purchases have been charged and or being finalized. You will soon receive an email from Backerkit that will enable you to finalize your purchase. Once you receive the Backerkit request, simply follow the instructions.

Looks like we hit the goal of 50k. 
All 200+ of you will be receiving these awesome limited edition card decks and frames. I want to thank all of you for your support and cant wait to hear from you once you receive them.
As a result of our funding I'm releasing the Mini Double deck frame as well.

Thank you all who took the time on this busy Holiday season to pledge for my thoughts. I call my creations thoughts, moments in my life where things evolve in my mind, literally. I was blessed with the ability to manifest my thoughts into physical objects. My Mother would tell me I day dreamed a lot as a kid, when I grew up I told her, but at least you can see, smell and touch my dreams Mom. :-)
You folks are on the path of possibly being able to share my thoughts with others and keep them in your possession for ever.
