campaign.story:
PLEASE NOTE:  All decks are UNBRANDED unless they specifically mention Bicycle Branded Limited Edition Green Backs.  (Available with some rewards and as add-ons)
The Different Deck is a standard deck of 54 playing cards with one major difference -  the cards are inverted so instead of a 3 of clubs, you have a club of 3s.
Instead of a 4 of diamonds, it is a diamond made up of 4s and so on.
Each card is a unique piece of art filled with symbolism and hidden elements. If you look closely at the queen of spades you will see "queen" not only written in several languages, but you will find a queen chess piece and even a Queen Elizabeth signature.
A year ago I launched the Different Deck project - a special deck of cards that was nearly 8 years in the making.  We raised over $70,000 and had over 1500 backers.  Plus, unlike most card projects we did not offer any dice, coins, poker chips or T-shirts.
Now, to celebrate the anniversary of the Different Deck, we are doing a limited Kickstarter exclusive Green Back edition of the Different Deck. 

These decks will ONLY be for backers of this campaign.

Plus, we are offering the much requested HOPE T-shirts, Different Dice, and a Lucky Coin among other collectibles.
        About the Original Different Deck
Each Different card is rich in meaning. Every dot, every swirl, every language, and every hidden item was placed where it was placed with thought and purpose.
The more you look at a card and the more you look for hidden elements, the more you will find - things like ambigrams and words sharing letters, like the "T" in one word making an "X" in another.

There are over 100 different languages and numeric systems represented in this deck, plus there is symbolism and imagery in each card as well (an ant on a queen, or a toy jack on a jack, or an 8 ball on an 8, and so on).  There are some really fun things in subjects ranging from science and math, to history and mythology.


        About the Green Back Different Deck
As expected, the Green Back Deck has green backs, but it is so much more. This deck takes the hidden messages of the previous deck and adds LUCK to them.  Plus, this deck is 100% inspired by Kickstarter backers. In fact, the original idea was from backer Jonathan Gorman.  Jonathan is an accountant and shortly after the Different Deck project ended he asked if it would be possible to do the 4 aces with a financial / money theme.
Nike, the artist for the Different Deck agreed and the 4 aces for the Green Back Deck were brought to life.

We were also asked by many backers for Different Dice and for T-shirts with the HOPE pips on it. Others asked for coins or poker chips and so here it all is.
Along with the green back and special edition aces, the card design features the special paper style used for US currency.

This is a limited run printed by USPCC (Less than 1000 Bicycle branded Green Backs will be printed - making it the rarest Different Deck of the 4).  We will only print as many decks as we need to fulfill this project.

Along with the Green Back Decks this project has some other
amazing rewards as well.
Different Dice
I have teamed up with my new friends at Daft Concepts and designed dice worthy of the name "Different". These dice are laser engraved in high quality birch wood. Sure, that is cool but the really cool part is they come shipped to you flat, pre-cut on pieces of wood the exact same size as a playing card (side note - 5 dice cards fit in a card box perfectly).

All you have to do is pop out the 6 sides, snap them together, and then enjoy the original artwork featuring elements of playing cards drawn in the classic Different Style.
     One: a crown that says one and is one solid piece
     Two: a spade with two dots in it
     Three: a heart made up of three pieces
     Four: a club made up of four pieces
     Five: a diamond made up of five pieces
     Six: a joker made up of six pieces
H.O.P.E. T-Shirt
A high quality grey T-shirt with the original H.O.P.E. pips printed across the chest.
Lucky Coin
  Make your own luck with a "Heads I win - Tails you lose" coin.
This is a coin for winners.This special 1.5" black and gold coin is not only inspirational, it is also fun. If you look closely at the Indian head and the fox tail you will see lots of hidden things in them (the coin was again designed by Nike Meyer) including the famous gag "Heads I win - Tails you lose",
Original Art
I have a few pieces of original signed art left from the original project, including the back design and the new money aces (well, three of the new money aces - Jonathan obviously gets one).
Here are the Different reward levels:
Note: You may add more decks (including the original Different Deck and coins and dice) to any level you like.  (See Add-Ons below.)
If you would like to add more lucky items to your reward simply up your reward amount by the extra amount for the items you want and then message me to let me know what you have added!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have made several decks before so I don't anticipate any problems there. I have also made T-shirts before, I have made coins and dice and stickers and even poker chips before. I have also gotten much better at fulfilling shipments thanks to Kickstarter. So assuming I stay healthy this should be a breeze.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Tomorrow morning I will be launching a new deck of cards...  Wait for it...

It is called the WORST DECK. (I promise it is better than it sounds)

Thanks to you the Different Deck Green Backs and all the fun extras are happening.
Here is just a quick overview of how it will unfold:

Right now credit cards are being charged.  If your card has not been charged please make sure to update your payment info otherwise kickstarter will drop you as a backer.

Later this week I will send out surveys – please do those right away - making sure to let me know what extras you added.

Next week I will submit the artwork to USPCC and start the process with all the other manufactures as well (coins, chips, dice, boxes, t-shirts, stickers OH MY

I have been in show business for over 20 years and I have never broken a leg...

Until yesterday.

Hello and thanks again for your support. 

So much to talk about (Bicycle unlocked, Poker Chips unlocked, new add-ons and a new stretch goal announced!!!!  Exciting times.

Congrats guys we already have over 380 backers - well done!
Ill be honest I have not done much of anything to promote this project so I appreciate your help spreading the word - I have been in Orlando working day and night on a top secret magic project Shhh.

Meanwhile I have been getting lots of requests. and to show I am here for you. Here you go.

campaign.story:
Think foreign language, delicious food, interesting culture, a thick 10,000-page novel while chilling at a rooftop pool, waiting for your pre-booked spa session…
EXPLORE is an expression of limitless imagination on what, where and how your next holiday can look like. The deck proudly showcases 52 popular destinations in drop-dead simple illustrations that you can enjoy even on your weekly poker nights.
Based on precious feedback from the first campaign, all 52 illustrations are now completed with fresh Joker, tuckcase and back designs. We are aiming to begin fulfilment process in early April 2015.
Join us in this journey by pledging to one of the rewards on the right. Rewards start at $15 for a single deck.
EXPLORE deck features 52 holiday destinations from all around the world. Each destination is carefully reviewed and hand picked by our team to give you just the best.
The deck will be printed by the USPCC on Bicycle stock with Magic finish.
                       Designed by: Daniel Haire and Tonia Gao
Edited by: Axel Hermann

campaign.story:
We use deodorant everyday, why not make it special? Chrome limited edition ClickStick with optional personalized engraving, which can be either your name or whatever you want to write. Kickstarter limited edition comes with a special Kickstarter engraving!
If we raise $70,000, we will add a beautiful FREE case for your ClickStick! You only buy ClickStick once so why not keep it in an elegant and sturdy case to carry when you travel or go to the gym?
 Watch...ABC7, USA TODAY  
Or read about us: CNET, Engadget, Daily mail, Emptylighthouse, TrustedNerd, ubergizmo
You can add as many refills as you want to your pledge. Refills come in two options: Containers and pouches.
At this stage, ClickStick is a fully functional prototype. We have developed a plan that will bring ClickStick to market as soon as possible, but need your support to drive the next step of production. You can see our production timeline here:
Gilad and Carla are the creators of ClickStick. They first met while studying at Princeton University for their PhD in Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering...yes rocket scientists!
Gilad had been frustrated with conventional deodorants for many years, especially with all their plastic waste! That’s where he noticed that deodorant application was one area of personal care that hadn't made significant (or any) advancements since the 50's. “There must be a better way than turning the archaic knob that always reminded me of dial phones and old car windows “.
When he met Carla, the idea of ClickStick started to come together as a product. She immediately identified with the need of ease of use products. Carla's father had suffered from ALS and had difficulty in simple everyday tasks, like applying deodorant.  She realized that there is reason why everyday task is not easy and fun. The ClickStick deodorant applicator was born to innovate the personal care space and make something you do everyday more enjoyable and fun!
Let’s get ClickStick!
Partners:
Mamash Creative Productions: A home for video productions, creativity, genius ideas, awesome (and crazy) people with a high level of professionalism and perfection.  
Jellop: a direct-response online advertising agency led by Iddo and Gil, two Internet veterans that are passionate about almost anything that’s online and can be optimized.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have worked hard to change the way we apply and manage our daily personal care experience and have finally come up with a prototype that is fully functional and useful.

As users, we have incorporated the standard deodorant design and incorporated technical functions that make it fun and easy to use for everyone. We have already created the first prototypes and are confident in starting production with the partnerships that we have developed, giving us the ability to scale up as soon as we can secure the funding from you. 

We already have interest from major brands to incorporate our application technology for deodorants and other personal care, and cosmetic applications.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Field Guide to Human-Centered Design is a new book from IDEO.org, and we need your help to make it happen.
The Field Guide is a fully illustrated introduction to human-centered design, an approach that problem solvers all over the world have used to tackle the challenges of poverty. It's also the evolution of the HCD Toolkit, a fantastic resource that has been purchased or downloaded 141,000 times.  
At IDEO.org, we address the world’s toughest problems, and we routinely come up with innovative solutions in sectors like sexual and reproductive health, water and sanitation, and financial opportunity thanks to human-centered design. 
But we're only a few dozen people in San Francisco. And though we wish we could solve all of the world's biggest challenges, we know that the only way to get there is to get nonprofits, social enterprises, foundations, social entrepreneurs, and well, everyone really, solving problems like designers. 
We’ve built a number of tools to spread and share human-centered design. Design Kit is our online platform which currently has 58,000 members; our online Course for Human-Centered Design has seen 40,000 people register from 148 countries over the past two years; and the HCD Toolkit has been downloaded over 141,000 times.
But there are places that the Internet just doesn’t go. And there are times out in the field, when your best friend is a good book. The Field Guide is just that friend, an ally in design and a key to help design a world without poverty.
The Field Guide includes step-by-step instruction on how to implement over 50 of the design methods that we at IDEO.org use every day. In addition, you’ll understand the key mindsets of human-centered design, read compelling case studies of our process in action, and have all the worksheets and tools you’ll need to put it into practice. 
 Human-centered design is an amazingly generative process, and one that starts with people and ends with surprising answers tailor-made to suit their needs. We use it to directly learn from the communities we're looking to serve, to rapidly come up with innovative new concepts, to quickly prototype them, and then to make our ideas come to life.
PLAY

And with the Field Guide we'll be able to get our approach to everyone all over the world. It won't matter if you have an Internet connection because the Field Guide has everything you need to understand the people you're designing for, to have more effective brainstorms, to prototype your ideas, and to ultimately arrive at more creative solutions. 
Thanks so much for your support!
IDEO.org
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
When the Field Guide to Human-Centered Design is fully funded we don't anticipate too many challenges. At IDEO.org we've got the design and editorial talent that we need to produce a great book, as well as a strong publisher with whom we've worked before.

If we do run into any problems, we fully intend to keep our community updated on our progress.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
OMFG! Series 4
Remember the fun of collectible mini figures like M.U.S.C.L.E. and Monster In My Pocket? So do we! That's why we are proud to present to you with five new awesome characters in our continuing line of OMFG - Outlandish Mini Figure Guys!
OMFG Series 4 consists of five figures including:
1. Fossil Freak designed by Michael Stearns from Washington and sculpted by George Gaspar from California
2. Wooly Wisp designed and sculpted by Billy Parker from South Carolina
3. Bullseye designed by (Raging Nerdgasm) Tom Khayos and Ana Bruja-Khayos from Florida sculpted by George Gaspar from California
4. Tree Witched designed by MudMarox and sculpted by GormTransMonster from Italy
5. The Siren designed by Corwin Webb from California and sculpted by George Gaspar from California
The OMFG project originated from the talented group of artists, designers, and toy enthusiasts on the October Toys/Toy Break forum (http://www.octobertoys.com/forum). After successful campaigns to produce the first three OMFG series (available now online and at many retail locations), hundreds of character ideas were submitted from all around the world and the forum voted for their favorite designs to be put in to production.
As you can see, bringing this project to life has truly been a community effort and now we invite you to be part of that community! The prototypes are finished and we are ready to move forward with overseas production. With the help of Kickstarter contributors like yourself, we look forward to continuing this fantastic line of community created figures.
We also invite you to come join us in the forum and submit your characters for future OMFG series at http://www.octobertoys.com/forum
Speaking of future series, we would like to note that voting for the next series of OMFG characters will be handled a little differently than previous series - only OMFG Series 4 Kickstarter backers will be able to vote on Series 5 designs. This includes all OMFG Series 4 Kickstarter backers who pledge $1 or more, regardless of reward level.
Monsterforge Customs
Charles Marsh (aka Monsterforge) is a designer and customizer who we are proud to have been working with since the very first series of OMFG. He has generously offered up his time and skills to provide a limited number of original hand painted resin prototyped of OMFG Series 4!
You can check out more of his work on his blog here: monsterforge.blogspot.com
Here are the 15 customs available to choose from:
Bonus OTMFG BrainWaves figure!
Ayleen and I decided to make the campaign more enticing! We are planning on making Joe Whiteford's BrainWaves figure in the next batch of OTMFG figures we produce, so we thought it would be fun to give him away to backers of OMFG Series 4 on Kickstarter!
Just like we did with the ZOMBIE Pheyden in OMFG S3 Kickstarter, the BrainWaves figure will be for all pledges $27 level and over. We will include a BrainWaves to match each set of OMFG in your pledge...for no extra charge! So if you pledge for one set of flesh OMFG and one set of black OMFG, you will also receive one flesh BrainWaves and one black Brainwaves. 
You have to back at least the $27 level in order to qualify, but you may add on extra sets to your order, and that will also get you extra BrainWaves!
BrainWaves is not part of the OMFG line, but presented as a bonus OTMFG (October Toys Mini Figure Guys) who will also play well with your other OMFG.
Huge thanks to Joe Whiteford http://joewhiteford.blogspot.com/ for helping us make this bonus figure possible. 
We can never thank everyone who has supported this project enough, but we hope you will enjoy BrainWaves as much as we do.
Please Note: BrainWaves will only be included free of charge with OMFG Series 4 sets pledged for on Kickstarter at the $27 level and above. We plan to make individual BrainWaves figures available for purchase from our online store in 2015.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
What about possible production delays?

Good question! We have over a decade of experience producing all kinds of toys, so we are very familiar with the process. We also have five successful Kickstarter campaigns under our belt which went quite smoothly (thanks to our awesome backers!). There are occasionally unavoidable delays with these types of projects (i.e. quality control, shipping, customs, etc.), but we have allowed enough time with our expected ship date to account for minor delays. Of course we try our best to keep all of our backers updated throughout the production process and would let you know if anything unexpected came up.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
WE ARE FUNDED!!!

If you want to find out anything else about the project please message me, leave a comment or use smoke signals. I will respond to you within 24 hours.
Thanks so much everyone and I can't wait to get these shipped out to you!
Cheers
If dice were drugs I would like to think my dice would be high grade ecstasy. And I need to deal my dice. 
I make dice. Dice of awesome.  
Dice are the gateway for reality and our imagination. So isn't it high time that you own a set that inspires you? A set that you love to marvel at? A set that your friends would say, "Holy sh&tballs, those dice are epic!" The Wizard's Gambit dice set is just that set.  
The Wizard's Gambit is my interpretation and embodiment of the Wizard's tutelage and intelligence. It is the representation of a wizards spell working on dice for greater luck. A wizard's Arcana Fortuna if you will. And who knows, perhaps these dice are really magically enhanced to help you slay your foes, swindle the unsuspecting and perform feats of awesomeness.  
My goal is simple, to bring dice into the world that bridges the gap between your gameplay and the stories unfolding in your mind. That and to make your friends wickedly jealous of your sweet shwag. Just saying.
 The Dice 
Creating dice is a lot of fun. I start by drafting designs on my Nexus 7. Surprisingly the drafting process can be somewhat difficult. You have to create a design that can scale down to less than 15 mm while still looking good and having the numbers easily legible. Not an easy feat especially when you are trying to create ridonkulous designs.
From there I import the designs into Photoshop (or Illustrator if I have a lot of touch ups) and size the designs to fit a die facet. The real fun begins here. Once the design is sized and set I take a blank die and place it in a laser engraver. Then I hit print in PS and watch the magic begin. In case you don't know, a laser engraver shoots a high wattage laser beam and burns images directly onto an object. It's literally like printing with ink except this printer can kill you. #Ilovetechnology. 
Once the die is created it's back to the drawing board, er, drawing tablet. I examine what's flawed in the design and make tweaks. Then I burn several new sets and the dice and the final prototype is made.
ADD-ONS
1) 6xD6 Add-on. If you wish to add 6xD6 just add an additional $12 to your pledge. Please message me letting me know that you increased your pledge for the 6xD6 add-on. 
2) 10xD10 Add-on. If you wish to add 10xD10 just add an additional $14 to your pledge. Please message me letting me know that you increased your pledge for the 10xD10 add-on.
3) KS Specialty Die - If you wish to add the KS specialty die add an additional $2.
4) Wizard's Gambit set add-on -- If you wish to add an extra set of the WG add an additional $14 and message me that you are adding it on.
5) Blood Spatter + Thieves Combo Plate add-on. If you wish to add the Thieves and Splatter set add an additional $30 to your order and message me.
6) Blood Splatter or Thieves set add-on - If you wish to add-on either Splatter or Thieves add an additional $15 for each set and message me.
6) Splatter or Thieves 6xD6 add-on. Ifyou wish to add 6xD6 of splatter or Thieves just add an additional $12 to your pledge per set. Please message to notify.
Stretch Goals

1) 20k - WG will be available in red numbering.   UNLOCKED
2) 25k - WG will be available in a blue die with white numbering UNLOCKED 
3) 30k - WG will be available in a white die and glow in the dark numbering   UNLOCKED
4) 35k - WG will be available in a black die with white numbering   UNLOCKED
5) 38.5k - Specialty Dice Case from Hrothgar's Hoard Dice Towers will be available as an add-on for $27 (international backers please contact me for shipping quote) UNLOCKED  
6) 40k - WG will be available in a black die with glow in the dark numbering UNLOCKED
7) Specialty Dice Towers from Hrothgar's Hoard Dice Towers will be available as add-ons for $75 (international backers please contact me for shipping quote) UNLOCKED
8) The Last Stretch Goal - If we hit 75k in pledges all backers will receive a free set of dice. You will be able to choose from any of the dice lines (Wizard's Gambit, Thieves, Blood Splatter or Neptune's Might). As well you will be able to choose the color style for the WG line.

campaign.story:
Impressions Playing Cards are designed by MakePlayingCards.com (MPC®), a professional custom playing cards printing and manufacturing company. With the success on our first campaign of our first ever branded playing cards earlier on the year, we are now introducing a whole new concept to a deck of playing cards which you can touch, feel and admire as well as play.
Stealth Edition
Close-up on high gloss - Stealth Edition
Table spread
Ace of spades
In addition to the traits of a traditional deck of cards, Impressions playing cards gives you the added sense of touch on the artwork, brought to you using the latest in printing and secondary process technology which we have recently invested heavily in. We are using premium quality 310gsm German casino grade card stock with a black core centre layer.
The Impressions Playing Cards range
Creating Impressions playing cards was by no means straight forward as the whole normal printing and production process of a traditional deck of cards had to be altered. Adding the special raised embossed gloss effect to the cards essentially increased the height of the deck so the cutting process had to be reconfigured. Also, the fact that we have applied this special layer on the surface top of each card meant that the finishing had to be completely changed so as to not lose the shine effect but keeping them true to their original purpose which is the playability aspect. We have had countless trials using different methods, materials and finishing which alone have lasted 3 months. We are now extremely happy to say that we have got it right.

The 3 decks (now 4 decks - 29 Sept.)
There are 2 main decks in this Kickstarter project. These are the Impressions Stealth Edition and the original Impressions deck. We also have an enlarge court cards special deck called the Impressions Court Edition.On 29th September, we released a new white deck called the Phantom Edition. This is the 4th deck to join the Impressions by MPC range.
Stealth Edition
Standard Edition
Court Edition
 And the all new Phantom Ed. deck
Phantom Ed. tuck box
Aside from our in-house traditional offset printers, latest large-scale digital industrial printers, this year we at QP have also invested significantly on state of the art secondary process machines, one of which we are using on our Impressions playing cards. This new digital technology is able to apply embossed UV to images with pinpoint accuracy. Some of you may say this is traditional spot UV but they are distinctively different. First of all, no expensive setup is required i.e. there is no MOQ. Second of all, spot UV is almost flat whereas this is able to achieve up to 250 microns (braille effect) in polymer height which is 100 times higher than selective varnish. It can be looked as a mix between enhanced UV and digitized embossing. We can apply different densities ranging from 1-100% through the same pass which normal spot UV cannot achieve. In terms of the glossiness, it achieves 99GU which is the highest gloss possible for printed material. What does this mean? Well, it means that your selected areas of colors will stand out even more through this raised gloss effect and what's more, you can experience the touching of it. The results are astounding which you can see in the photos here.
We have applied this glossy raised effect onto the cards here in this project as well as onto the tuck boxes. What’s more, we have found a way to make the cards playable even after apply this secondary process which is a major breakthrough.
We took the traditional design for playing cards which is in the public domain, redrew the card faces completely making the design unique to the MPC brand. For the back, we also come up with a symmetrical design using a tree as the focal point since playing cards are essentially paper which originates from trees, hence the inspiration for the design.
card back design
The MPC Impressions range
As mentioned above, there are 3 decks in this project. The original Impressions deck is the main deck with the glossy embossed effect applied to it. The Stealth Edition is a really special design using the color black and virko to create the stand out design. The Court Edition enlarges the artwork on the court cards which aside from the unique design, players can properly experience the look and the touch and feel of the polymer applied to the card faces. We love all three decks as these should be the first on the market using this kind of new technology.
Stealth Edition
Standard
Court Edition
The tuck boxes for this Kickstarter project is unique and limited to our Kickstarter backers in this project only. How? Well, we have especially printed "Kickstarter Edition" on the top flap of the boxes as shown below. We have applied varying levels of virko densities to different areas of the box. Basically the more polymer we apply to a specific area, the more raised and glossier it becomes. On top of this, if we reach funding of more than $10k, we will be adding our special gold foil seals to the boxes as an added mark of authenticity of a limited edition deck. These KS edition boxes will never be produced and released again so once they're gone, they're gone.
Tuck boxes - different density levels to different areas
Tuck box close-up

How do they handle? Can they bend?
Some people are curious as to how these cards handle and whether they can bend. Using my limited handling skills, I created 2 videos for you to analyze and to help answer your many questions. Enjoy!
$10,000: If we reach this funding goal, we will upgrade our tuck box seals to digital gold stamped foil. Beautiful!
Gold foil seals
Unveiling the Phantom Ed. deck
We have also added the all new Phantom Ed. deck which we released on the 20th day of our project. It's available as a add-on for $13.
Impressions Phantom Ed.
The 1st ever MPC chips give away to pledges of $35+
With the addition of another newly sought digital UV printing machine, we created the first ever MPC chips which we are going to give away in this project. As we have limited stock availability and to control the costs, if your total pledge amount including your add-ons is over $35 at the end of the project, we will include one of these MPC chips into your package as shown below. Very attractive!
MPC chips
Pledges breakdown
Add-ons price list

Standard and Court Edition uncut sheets
Phantom Ed. Limited Ed. Uncut Sheet
As a special thank you to all our backers for backing us on this project, we will hopefully be able to include a gift for everyone. The gift will depend on the funding that we achieve here though and may come in the form of an item or a coupon.
We are MakePlayingCards.com, a professional custom playing cards printing service, owned and run by QP Group, a major high street board games printing and production company since 1982. We released our popular online playing cards making site in 2012 and since then, it has grown massively in demand through rigorous improvements to the user's online experience to sourcing the best playing card stock materials, card finishing, printing technology and our services. This was only made possible by our years of experience in games development, constant collaboration with our end consumers, operating with an open mind to change and a real desire to become one of the best. Our casino quality cards are comparable with the best in the industry in terms of print, production and handling.

campaign.story:
This deck of playing cards is dedicated to all the blue collar workers who understand what it’s like to actually do an honest day’s worth of work. These are the men and women who earn their rights to relax with that cold glass of beer at the end of the day. This Bicycle deck was designed by Johnny Whaam. The fine detail of each hand drawn card is reminiscent of a hard working, manufacturing America.
Printed by the United States Playing Card Company on their classic air-cushion finish, each of these 54 cards features detailed, hand drawn, original art including a custom tuck case, custom pips, and a custom deck seal.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
A playing card project is a big task. There are so many elements that have to work together in order for a playing card project to function smoothly and succeed with satisfied backers with decks of cards in their hands.

The ARMY Playing Card project will be my 6th playing card project and 9th project on Kickstarter, all of which have been successful in both raising the funds and also delivering backer's rewards. I have learned so much from my past Kickstarters. I have learned some valuable lessons of what TOO do, and what NOT too do.

Below are the biggest three hurdles with any playing card project, and how I plan to overcome them:

1. Keeping your rewards & add on system simple and easy to understand.

As I did with both my Federal 52 Part II, Sherlock Holmes & Independence projects I have given the pledge tiers Alphanumeric labels to help you understand what you are pledging for. Beside every pledge tier there is a letter/number key that you can match up with a graphic that will give you a visual representation of what is included in that pledge tier.

2. Keeping International Shipping transparent and easy to understand. 

I have received my share of bumps and bruises in the past trying to figure out the most transparent and understandable method of communicating to international backers how much to add for Int. shipping. Int. Shipping is expensive, there is no way around it. I ship all of my deck using the USPS. It is not my intention to try and profit form international shipping I'm only trying not to go broke from it. I am totally transparent with shipping costs and have included an average breakdown of how much international shipping costs both you and me, so that all the information is out on the table, so you can be a well informed backer.

3. Fulfillment is by for the most difficult process of any playing card project.

With my first Federal 52 Project I got my hands calloused by tackling the fulfillment of 3000 orders by myself. With my second project, Federal 52 Part II, I ventured out and gave a fulfillment company a shot at taking on the challenge. I have learned that playing cards and the shipping of them is an art in and of itself. Something that is VERY important to me is that the same amount of care and detail is given to the packing and shipping of my playing cards as is going into the design. Because of this fact I have recently formed a company that specializes in nothing but shipping playing cards and add ons for Playing Card projects. My fulfillment company is called Kings Wild Fulfillment and it has a full time staff that is dedicated to handling, packing and fulfilling you rewards with a level of excellence that you expect from anything with the Kings Wild logo on it.

As of now Kings Wild Fulfillment has successfully fulfilled two playing card projects with over 5000 unique orders.

ALL rewards, whether you order 1 deck or 500 will arrive in a corrugated cardboard box. I will be using a variety of industructo brand boxes form ULINE.

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone. I hope everyone had a great weekend. I wanted to update you guys on a small color change I have made to the 1910 Standard Deck. I had received a lot of feedback from people about their concern that the hearts and diamonds were a light Olive Drab color instead of Red, and the functionality and readability of the suites.
I have decided to go back with the traditional colors and change the hearts and diamonds back to a deep red instead of olive drab. Below I have two images of the before and after and examples of how the colors have changed.

If your making an US ARMY deck it's hard to do it without putting George Washington in it. General Washington was the highest ranking General in US military history. One of the only 2 Generals in history to be given the Rank of General of the Armies of the United States. He was given this rank posthumously on July 4th 1976.

MINT deck unlocked!  $16k stretch-goal reached!
 Now that we've reached $16k in funding, the second color deck - MINT is now available!  Inspired by money, the cards feature green, black and metallic inks on an ivory background.  Packaged in a charcoal and silver tuck box, with a new ornate front graphic.
All backers pledged for 2 or more decks have the option of replacing up to half of their Original White decks for Mint.  (For example: pledge for 4 decks and receive up to 2 Mint decks with 2 White decks.)
Four Point Playing Cards is an original deck of cards designed by Ben Vierck. Drawing inspiration from the intricate designs of money, ancient symbols, impossible geometry, and yoga mudras; the original art was illustrated by hand. Each court card, ace, joker, card back and box illustration are offered on Kickstarter as rewards to help fund the production of the deck. Designed in San Francisco and made in the USA, this top-quality deck is manufactured by the legendary United States Playing Card Company (USPCC).

All the Four Point Playing Cards rewards have been shipped. The majority of packages were sent last week, with the final few going-out this Monday, December 15th. By this time, many US backers have started receiving their decks. International orders will take longer, depending upon location and time in customs. Please feel free to contact me directly with any questions or concerns.
I would like to give a special shout-out and thank you to my girlfriend Makenna, who worked tirelessly to help package and ship over 500 orders. It was quite a week.

Shipping
The US Postal Service picked-up the first batch of orders earlier today. I will be shipping every day this week, and barring any major obstacles, all orders will be in the mail by next Monday (December 15th). This means that every U.S. package and the majority of International packages should arrive before Christmas. We are working long days and nights to get everything out as soon as humanly possible.

I'm pleased to announce, that after a year of culmination - I've received the decks from the US Playing Card Company! Yesterday was spent breaking down the two pallets (and 1,500 lbs.) of cards now currently occupying most of my living space!

Hi All,
I'm happy to report that the project is still on schedule for delivery before the December holidays.
The tucks are made and the USPCC is printing the cards this week.  I'm adding a little something special to each deck, stay tuned for more details.

campaign.story:
cnet - "The pen that can write in any color on earth"
VentureBeat - "This smart pen’s ink changes based on whatever color you scan"
IFLScience - "Pen lets you draw any color in the world"
Daily Mail - "Forget crayons Multicolour pen lets pick colour draw 16 million shades"
Gizmodo - "Scribble Ink lets users draw with colors that they find around them"
Springwise - "16 million color pen can match its ink to the shade of any real world object"
HuffingtonPost - "This Pen Can Draw Every Single Color In The World"
Science Alert - "This pen lets you draw every single colour in the world"
iO9 - "This Incredible Pen Lets You Write In Any Color You See"
The Daily Dot - "The Scribble pen lets you draw using any color in the world"
COLOR REPRODUCTION AND USE THAT'S SO EASY IT'S ALMOST LIKE MAGIC
With the Scribble scanning and capturing any color is easy and fast. Simple hold the Scribble’s scanner up to any color, like on a wall, a fruit, a book or magazine, a painting or even a child’s toy and within a second or two that color is stored in Scribble’s internal memory.
Once stored, that color can then be used to draw on paper (with the Scribble INK)
or to draw on a digital screen (with the Scribble STYLUS) instantly.
WHO CAN USE THE SCRIBBLE PEN?
The Scribble is intended for anyone who needs access to a wide range of colors as well as the facility to easily and quickly reproduce any color.. Children will love the Scribble because it can create a myriad of different colors, completely replacing even their biggest box of crayons or marking pens. It will also let them instantly scan and draw with any color they see on any object around them.
Artists, graphic designers, interior decorators, fashion designers, or anyone working with color in their professional lives, will be able to scan color from any product, surface or chart, and instantly reproduce the identical color, to be used either on paper or on an electronic device of their choice.
Our nib set offers you a fantastic range of stroke weights. Choose from fine to heavy depending on your mood! We offer 6 tip sizes, 0.3mm, 0.5mm, 1.0mm, 1.5mm, 2.5mm and 3.71mm
Those with color vision problems, homeowners and professional painters will find Scribble to be an amazing tool that makes their lives much easier with its color scanning ability. Any color can be scanned and reproduced, making color-matching a breeze and home / business painting much simpler.
Both the Scribble Stylus and Ink can hold thousands of different colors and reproduce them exactly. The Scribble will literally replace a box full of crayons or marking pens and make color reproduction fast and simple for any project and application.
The Scribble Pen and Stylus pairs with a mobile app to instantly sync every color you scan directly onto your iPhone, iPad or Android mobile device. Your colors become more useful when they are organized, tagged, searchable and converted to various color models.
SCRIBBLE IS THE BEST COLOR – GREEN
One of the most outstanding features of the Scribble is that, since it can reproduce any color, it replaces thousands of marking pens, thereby greatly reducing the huge amount of plastic waste cluttering up our landfills all over the world.
It's easy being green with Scribble Pen
WHAT'S INSIDE THE SCRIBBLE / TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS?
There will be 2 Scribble pens, the Scribble INK and the Scribble STYLUS. The INK will be able to reproduce exact colors on regular paper. It features a color sensor, 1 GB of internal memory that will store over 100,000 UNIQUE colors, a rechargeable Battery, Bluetooth 4.0 connectivity, a Micro-processor and 5 ink cartridges. The STYLUS features are exactly the same as the INK, minus the ink cartridges as it is intended for use on a computer screen.
RGB Color sensor
1-2 Seconds color capture time
Very ACCURATE color reproduction
Compatible with PHOTOSHOP
Advanced Ink management system
1GB internal memory
ARM Processor
Micro USB charging
Rechargeable Lithium-ion battery
Bluetooth Smart (Bluetooth 4.0)
Lightfast long lasting Ink
Capacitive rubber nib & Harder finer tips for the STYLUS
Nib set for the INK pen: Our nib set offers you a fantastic range of stroke weights. Choose from fine to heavy depending on your mood! We offer 6 tip sizes,  0.3mm, 0.5mm, 1.0mm, 1.5mm, 2.5mm and 3.71mm
Supports iPhone and Android OS.
Supports PC and MAC
Program your own custom colors: Program your own dream colors via our Mobile App. You can add and draw without worrying about what is captured in the Pen sensor.
CHOOSE YOUR COLOR
HOW DID WE CREATE THE SCRIBBLE?
We've been in the design process for two years and the Scribble has gone through various design changes to get it to where we are now, a working prototype that’s ready for use in home and business applications. Because of its small size we have created a number of innovations never seen before in the color reproduction industry. We are also always looking for feedback and opinions from our supporters and want to create a community of supporters as part of this Kickstarter project. We created Scribble for YOU and want you to be a part of the process!
PROTOTYPE DESIGNS
FINAL DESIGNS
WHAT ARE REWARDS?
THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT
Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our Kickstarter Campaign and discover the Scribble. Thank you also for your generous support! Make sure to bookmark our Kickstarter page and check back often to see the progress of the campaign as well as the updated times for manufacturing and delivery of your Scribble.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any ground-breaking and innovative project, risks and challenges are a major factor. At this stage, we have identified our primary real significant risk to be the injection moulding process. This process involves the largest outlay of capital expenditure. We want to get the best quality finish for the Scribble Pen and as such, our team has put a considerable amount of time into sourcing our injection moulded parts and working with the relevant suppliers.

Our R&D team consists of many multi-talented individuals with vast experience in the fields of engineering, color science and industrial design. To get to where we are today, we have overcome many challenges and have made great progress in identifying and assessing the risks which are part of this highly complex project.

The greatest challenge we now face, is taking this project from a working prototype into mass production. Our design is highly complex and innovative and we require unique production technology.

Many Kickstarter campaigns encounter difficulties at this crucial stage of taking the prototype into production. The challenge involves finding the correct suppliers and engineering products and ensuring that the production process will be smooth and risk free. We have been working for many months on this, negotiating with suppliers, testing component quality, and building up a strong team that will be able to deliver on our promises.

From the start of our campaign through to the delivery, we intend to keep you fully updated on all the stages of our progress. We will keep you fully informed regarding details of unexpected issues or delays, if any, and we promise to be fully transparent on all aspects of the project at all times.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
All my life I have been inthralled with the art of intaglio engraving of the late 1890s specifically from currency and bank notes. This art style is some of the most intricate and timeless and is also daily over look.
A little over a year ago I quite my job to pursue my life long dream of owning my own creative business and develop my own ideas. It's been an incredible ride and to celebrate my one yearish anniversary I wanted to return to where it all started for me, the art of money. 
Last year I designed a fully custom deck of playing cards inspired by the art of money. While designing this deck I realized that I only scratched the surface of how incredible this art was. The art of playing cards is extremely small and I wanted to experience the art on a large scale, so I set out to recreate one of my favorite notes. 
I got my ink pens and vellum paper and set out to replicate the intricate line work of an art form that has all but faded away. Once finished the art took on an entirely new form. Seeing every single line that before were only millimeters long on the original note.
It is my hope during this project to create a piece of art that you as a backer can enjoy and get of glimpse of the beautiful art work of currency of the late 1890s.
If you back this project you will receive a 24" x 10" lithograph print of an original hand inked drawing of the 1896 $5 Silver Certificate. Lithography print will come rolled and shipped in a mailing tube.
Please help make this Kickstarter a reality by backing and sharing on Facebook, Twitter and other social media outlets.
60" x 26" Original Hand Inked Reproduction
Click image for high res
If you would like to add on more than one print to your pledge simply ADD $25 per print to your existing pledge. All prints will be shipped in the same tube. 
 ADD $25 to your pledge for each additional print.
60" x 26" Original Hand Inked Reproduction
24" x 10" Lithography Print 
Image of the original three educational notes.
click for high res
click for high res
The Kickstarter video was created by Taylor Robinson my most incredible brother who owns Six Foot Five Productions. Click the link to see some of his awesome work. He plays a very important part in all of the Kings Wild Projects.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With any crowdfunding project there are many factors that play into creating a successful project. Creating an incredible reward that both captivates and satisfies the backer is only 50% of the task. Producing and fulfilling the rewards is just as important as the creation. 

If successful this project will be my 8th created and 8th successful project. I am fully experienced with the speed bumps that come along with a crowdfunded project and I am fully prepared to handle every aspect of it.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
America has a story to be told. We've been through World Wars and Civil War... we've seen the dawn of modern times with innovations like the light bulb, assembly line and airplane... within less than a hundred year span we saw the Wright Brothers take the first flight and then watched in awe while we landed a man on the moon. Indeed, America does have a grand story to be told and with every story comes a beginning.
Since the start of 2014 the Unrest Series of playing cards has told the story of WWII, in Global Unrest, where America joined forces with other Allied nations to end the tyranny of Nazi Germany. We also told the story of the American Civil War, in Civil Unrest, where America redefined the meaning of the words, "ALL MEN ARE CREATED EQUAL".
Now, we are extremely proud to introduce the third and final chapter of the Unrest Series where the story of US began. Before we could fight for the freedom of others, we needed to fight for the freedom of US!!!
"The time is near at hand which must determine whether Americans are to be free men or slaves." - George Washington
   
Colonial Unrest Playing Cards
Printed by the United States Playing Card Co.
Bicycle branded
Over 52 hand drawn illustrations featuring notable people during the American Revolutionary War
 At first we we planned to create two separate decks to maximize the number of people featured within the deck (2 sets of 12) but we decided to utilize the numbered cards (2 through 10) to feature as many people as possible. Throughout the project backers will be voting and nominating American Revolutionary people they wish to see in the deck. New cards will be revealed throughout the month long campaign. We encourage interaction during this project. We want to invite our backers to help out with the creative process. So, please keep up to date with our updates and join us at facebook.
Note: Some of the images show Global Unrest items. These will be updated shortly.
These will come unsigned. We have pledge levels that include signed art prints.

I was contacted by a person that says a private group of people are complaining about the paper wrapping.  I'm not disappointed in them because my family and I did the job ourselves and I'm very proud of the results. We were going to have them done professionally but after receiving a high ball quote and having several 1000s in dropped pledges we had to make the tough choice of doing these by hand.  This was an additional feature of the cards and not the main attraction. 
I, along with my family, hand cut, hand wrapped and hand sealed these cards. With the death of my Grandfather on Saturday it has made this job especially difficult to do. I'm sorry if anyone is disappointed... but I for one, am very proud of the results.

campaign.story:
I want you to draw. 
My name is Ray Sumser and I'm a life long artist. Kickstarter has shown me the joy of including others in my process and the possibility of inspiring others to create.
Back this project I'll add your art into a massive collaborative drawing. 
You could draw anything: yourself, a friend, a character you made up, a hat, a centipede, a heart, a roller-skate - - anything. Let's try to keep it kid friendly.
All drawing levels are acceptable. It will be especially cool to place budding artists next to the accomplished. 
My dream is to have as many collaborators as possible. Think WORLD RECORD status.  I don't know if that's possible, but if we go far enough I'll find out.
Get drawing!
As of 12pm EST, July 17:
 SEND IN YOUR ART!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Having done seven successful Kickstarter projects, I feel ready and able to complete this project. If I am successful, the real challenge will be to manage the imagery in an intelligent way.

updates.update_content:
Hello Collaborators!
I hope the Fall is treating you well.
I wanted to point you to my new project - where I'm funding a year in studio space to create my biggest work to date. I hope you'll come on board with me again. This time I'm offering a 2016 monthly calendar of my art in exchange for $20 in support.

Below is the final image as it was printed and sent out to backers in January. I may still be missing a piece of art or two... If yours isn't in there, kindly remind me and I'll be sure to add it and send you an updated image. Here is a dropbox link in case you want to really really huge file of the image. Thank you so much!
Ray

The project has shipped!
Keep your eyes on the mail - once people have started to receive postcards and prints I'll post the final image here.
So excited!
Ray

Hi there! I hope you're all doing well and staying warm. I'm working hard to position my art for the holidays. I've been waiting on art and survey responses from the last hand full of backers - if I don't hear from you by Friday I'll assume you're foregoing inclusion in the piece. I'll update with final imagery this weekend and prints will be ordered a week from now. 
Excited to send this project out into the world soon!

Well that was a little bit of magic. In the very last minutes of the campaign, another big funder came through and put the project over it's goal. I'm flabbergasted and still just acclimating to this new reality. I'm so stoked and grateful - and feel charged with a desire to really do something meaningful with this project. 
The project page is locked, but keep send in your art. Revisions are totally OK! I am going to take tonight to feel out what needs to happen next with this project. In the meantime I am so thankful to everyone who helped make it happen and will find more ways to reward EVERY BACKER and to do something bigger with what you've contributed.

campaign.story:
RongoRongo Gold Edition Playing Cards inspired by RongoRongo scribes of Easter Island and Polynesian tribal masks. Printed by USPCC.
RongoRongo is an original deck of American playing cards designed by Tomas Leszczynski (bio) in New York and produced by the United States Playing Card Company (USPCC). The deck is independently designed and honors an amazing civilization of Easter Island. Printed with metallic gold.
Matifu was created to bring educational games to the market. Matifu means “sand,” or “sand dunes” in Swahili; the name was inspired by my devotion to crowdfunding and an amazing power of backers to change people’s lives.
Features:
Printed by the United States Playing Card Company
Limited Print for this KS campaign
All original illustrations
Gold Metallic ink
High quality tuck case with Gold foil
Bee stock
First 1,500 decks SIGNED directly on the tuck-box
RongoRongo BLACK deck
Available as ADD-ON only
Limited Print: 1,000 decks
Master Finish
EPCC at Conjuring Arts, New York City
Embossing / foil on Tuck-box
Limited edition seal numbered x/1,000
First 200 decks hand signed and with Early Bird pricing.
Please go to:
http://www.matifu.com/rongorongo/backers_black.html
to register early bird and/or limited print and >> THEN >> process ADD-ON payment on Kickstarter.

Available as ADD-ON only

http://www.matifu.com/rongorongo/backers_gilded.html

It’s year 1300; the age of crusades slowly reaches its end in Europe. The population of Easter Island thrives. In five hundred years since their arrival, the people of Easter Island evolved into a highly organized society under the rule of the king wielding god-like power. Throughout the island large engineering programs take place, moving massive MOAIs to the edges of the ocean, surrounding the island in statues worshiping their ancestors.
The system of glyphs called RongoRongo is used to record the events; it may be one of the very few independent inventions of writing in the entire human history. Although the attempts of decode RongoRongo are ongoing for over two hundred years, it continues to evade code breakers and most of it remains a mystery.
The demands this most advanced society placed on the environment reached the critical point during the race to erect huge MOAI statues; the process probably used the remaining supply of trees on the island.
The culture of Easter Island remains a striking example of what happens to advanced societies when they push the environment past the breaking point. This project pays homage to RongoRongo scribes who created those amazing glyphs.
RongoRongo Gold back detail.
Animated RongoRongo Gold back (please wait for GIF to load).
The fan of RongoRongo Gold backs creates a large image inspired by a symbol of Sun God.
RongoRongo Gold Ace. 
RongoRongo Gold Aces.
RongoRongo Gold Face Card detail.
The face cards show the tribal masks based on Easter Island and Polynesian patterns. Kings feature RongoRongo glyphs of men, Queens feature RongoRongo glyphs of flowers and Jacks feature RongoRongo glyphs of canoes. Canoes are represented by many glyphs in RongoRongo language, suggesting a vibrant fishing industry on Easter Island. The loss of all trees marks the end of fishing and the beginning of the collapse of the entire civilization until there were only 111 Rapa Nui left. Today the island is home to a vibrant culture with more than 3,000 people who claim Rapa Nui heritage.
RongoRongo Gold Spade Face Cards.

RongoRongo Gold Clubs Face Cards.
RongoRongo Gold Diamonds Face Cards.
RongoRongo Gold Jokers.

RongoRongo Gold Jack of Clubs.
RongoRongo Gold pip card design closeup. Pip cards feature gold RongoRongo glyphs and a large RongoRongo watermark. 
RongoRongo Gold Tuck box.
RongoRongo Gold tuck box seal. We will upgrade to gold seal once a stretch goal is reached.
Stretch Goals
Goal $15,000 / LOCKED

Goal $20,000 / LOCKED

Goal $25,000 / LOCKED

Goal $40,000 / LOCKED
Once $40,000 Stretch goal funding is reached, we will release a new deck available as an add-on and in new pledges.
The first backer who deciphers the above “full disclosure” will be called Birdman (or Birdwoman) for the duration of the campaign. The position comes with a royal treatment but without any gifts or a power to rule others (that would be against KS policy).
The Birdman cult and IronMan-like competitions followed the toppling of MOAIs on Eastern Island. The winner of the competition (actually, the sponsor of the winner) held the title of Birdman for one year. The title came with an absolute power to rule other clans and collect gifts and taxes.
The competition involved scaling sheer cliffs, swimming in shark infested waters to an adjacent island and returning with the first egg of the season to the starting line. It’s safe to assume that the mortality rate among racers of the Birdman competition was quite high.
Kevin Costner co-produced a movie based on Birdman race on Easter Island:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rapa-Nui_%28film%29

Several designs of t-shirts will be available, but I would like to start with "go solar" which carries a powerful message in RongoRongo. When people on Easter Island cut the last tree, they unleashed the domino effect which devastated their society. Without the trees, there was no more canoes or fishing. The birds, so plentiful on the island, lost their nesting grounds and left. Without the natural fertilizer from the birds the soil eroded, making it very difficult to grow food. So let's go solar...
T-shirts will be available in S,M,L,XL,XXL and in GREY, BLACK and WHITE colors.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I completed thousands of graphic design projects (please see bio), so I am very comfortable dealing with any printing issues. I completed another Kickstarter project "Rotary Wedge" fulfilling all pledges and learning quite a bit in the process. Depending on the size of pledges I may use a fulfillment center to ship all products to backers.

Fulfillment is clearly a difficult part of this project, as dealing with many packages and various orders is challenging. We will either use Stamp.com with their automated system or give the entire project to the fulfillment center if the size of the shipment overpowers our in-house capabilities.

The deck will be printed at the United States Playing Card company, which was producing the highest quality products for decades.

The international shipping cost is difficult to estimate and it’s very high regardless of a carrier used. We will use United States Post Office for all shipments; we were very successful in the past shipping similar projects.

We will be using corrugated boxes for shipping to avoid a potential damage when shipped in a padded envelope. Although it adds to the cost I want to make sure the decks arrive without damage often associated with shipments using envelopes.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Thanks to all Kickstarter backers who forged the Treasure Chest with us! If you discover the Treasure Chest after the project ends, you can pre-order it and/or any of the add-ons (wooden stars and metal coins) through the Stonemaier Games website.
The creators of Viticulture, Euphoria, and Tuscany bring you the Stonemaier Games Treasure Chest, an assortment of premium-grade realistic resource gaming tokens (gold, wood, ore, stone, clay, and gems). All tokens come pre-painted.
We love how realistic resource tokens add to any tabletop game experience, and we want to share that with fellow gamers around the world. We've already created the sculpts for these tokens--now we just need your help to make them a reality!
We will add 1 resource token for every 100 backers (+1 gold after the first 100 backers, then +1 wood after the next 100 backers, and so on). We'll update the total each morning.
Day 1: 120 total tokens (20 each of gold, wood, ore, stone, clay, and gems)
Day 2: 131 total tokens (22 each of gold, wood, ore, stone, and clay; 21 gems)
Day 3: 133 total tokens (23 gold, and 22 each of wood, ore, stone, clay, and gems)
Day 4: 135 total tokens (23 each of gold, wood, and ore; 22 each of stone, clay, and gems)
Day 5: 136 total tokens (23 each of gold, wood, ore, and stone; 22 each of clay and gems)
Day 6-7: 137 total tokens (23 each of gold, wood, ore, stone, and clay; 22 gems)
Day 8: 138 total tokens (23 each of gold, wood, ore, stone, clay, and gems)
Day 9: 139 total tokens (24 gold; 23 each of wood, ore, stone, clay, and gems)
Day 10: 140 total tokens (24 each of gold and wood; 23 each of ore, stone, clay, and gems)
Day 11-12: 142 total tokens (24 each of gold, wood, ore, and stone; 23 each of clay and gems)
Day 13: 143 total tokens (24 each of gold, wood, ore, stone, and clay; 23 gems)
Day 14: 144 total tokens (24 each of gold, wood, ore, stone, clay, and gems)
Day 15: 145 total tokens (25 gold; 24 each of wood, ore, stone, clay, and gems)
Day 16: 147 total tokens (25 each of gold, wood, and ore; 24 each of stone, clay, and gems)
Day 17: 149 total tokens (25 each of gold, wood, ore, stone, and clay; 24 gems)
FINAL: 156 total tokens (26 each of gold, wood, ore, stone, clay, and gems)
We'll round up at the end of the project to make sure the tokens are evenly distributed.
You can see a growing list of games that use these resources on BGG here.
Thanks to the worldwide fulfillment system explained on our Kickstarter Lessons blog here and here, we have very cost-effective ways of shipping the Treasure Chest.
Only pay the shipping fee once per pledge (any # of units, reward level, or country code). After selecting your reward level, add the shipping cost to your pledge total.
The following may be added to the $33 pledge level and above. After selecting your reward level, add this cost to your pledge total:
Any backer may pledge to the $290 level--you don't have to be a retailer.
Viticulture & Tuscany are available for pre-order through our website, as are the wooden stars and lira as stand-alone purchases. We also have a few copies of Euphoria.
Money-Back Guarantee: If you decide you don't like the Treasure Chest within 1 month of receiving it, you can return it for a full pledge refund (see FAQ).
Huge Discount: Based on the manufacturing cost, the Treasure Chest should have an MSRP of $60. We can keep the price much lower by only selling the first print run directly through Kickstarter, our website, and Amazon.
Make It Better for Everyone: The more backers we get, the better the Treasure Chest will be (see stretch goals). The Kickstarter price will remain the same, but the post-Kickstarter price will increase as we add tokens.
Localized Shipping: Our shipping prices for pre-ordered games are so low because we send games in bulk to fulfillment centers around the world. This is your chance to lock in the lowest possible shipping rate.
We Need You: We need your financial support to be able to manufacture and ship these Treasure Chests to gamers around the world.
Free Euphoria Recruits: We're including 16 updated and revised Euphoria recruit cards in every Treasure Chest. They'll also be available from BGG for $5 in December.
We selected the resources for this first Treasure Chest with the help of thousands of voters on our website. Thus the resources in this Treasure Chest are set--we won't be adding any more or it would significantly impact the production schedule.
However, we still want to hear your ideas for future Treasure Chests. We're particularly interested in resources that (a) can be represented in a "realistic" way, (b) aren't already produced by another company, and (c) apply to several popular games (not just one game).
The realistic resource tokens in the Treasure Chest are a great way to upgrade the retail version of Euphoria (shown here).
We anticipate that some backers may want a ton of a specific type of resource--for example, enough gold tokens to fill a swimming pool. There are companies that are really good at selling individual resource tokens...but we are not one of them.
Our supply chain is based on creating one cohesive version of this premium product, making it affordable for you, and shipping it to you quickly and cost-effectively.
photo courtesy of Kim Euker at http://kiestone.smugmug.com/
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Treasure Chest is a first for us in that it's not a game--rather, it's a box full of tokens used in a number of games. The challenge with these tokens is that they're all custom sculpts and moulds, which can be time-consuming and expensive to perfect. Fortunately we have lots of experience with wooden, resin, and metal pieces from Viticulture, Euphoria, and Tuscany.

With such precious components in every box, we're taking extra precautions to make sure the contents arrive safe and sound. Specifically, we will use a microfiber-lined box insert to protect the tokens from scratching, and there will be a layer of bubble wrap inside each box. The boxes will be made of very sturdy 2mm cardboard that can be stored vertically as well as horizontally without dumping the contents.

Stonemaier Games established an advisory board of industry veterans in January '13 to help us mitigate risks and challenges. So even though we will surely face new challenges in the future, we have an incredible team of experienced advisors to point us in the right direction.

If you would like to know more about what we learned from our Kickstarter experiences and research, go to www.stonemaiergames.com to see 100+ Kickstarter Lessons to help you create a successful project too.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hi! I hope you had a great weekend. I'm here with a quick update regarding something that you probably already know about, but I just want to make sure you don't miss out.
Also, I want to note up front that this will be the final project update I post on this project. I've really appreciated your collaboration on these treasure chests over the years, and if you want to continue being involved with our treasure chest series, you can join our Treasure Chest Facebook group.

As you may know from updates here and (more recently) on the more recent treasure chest project, the next pre-order campaign we're planning is for three thematic chests: the Adventure Atlas, Terror Tome, and Gadget Guide. Panda is currently creating their versions of the sample sculpts (Scott Wadyko is the original sculptor), and we should receive them in a few weeks.

The update I posted today featured photos of the new treasure chest tokens. I got some great feedback about them in the comments, and I relayed them to Scott, who reminded me that there were actually more recent photos of those tokens.
So below are those photos. We are going to try some other options for the damage token, as people didn't seem to be a fan of that one. We're open to other suggestions as well.

updates.update_userinfo: Backer Poll and New Chest Names

Backer Poll
I announced that the next treasure chest project (launch date unknown, but most likely after we deliver the latest batch of treasure chests) on that update. After much deliberation using data from previous polls and conversations on project updates, I decided that the next campaign would feature a total of 2 treasure chests. Some of the games listed on the spreadsheet don't have the token amounts listed on BGG, so if you have a copy of those games, you can replace the question marks with actual numbers.

Based ideas shared by the new treasure chest backers (many of which originated with you), I configured 5 different possible treasure chests for the future. I confirmed with sculptor Scott Wadyko that we can make these work.

campaign.story:
Thank you to all our backers who made SOMETHING happen!!!
Something is a food grade silicone baking form with endless possibilities. From brownies to bath bombs, you can make almost anything with Something.

Something is:
Dishwasher Safe
Oven Safe
Durable
Made in the USA
And fun
Plus, Something comes complete with an idea/cookbook with 365 ideas, literally something for every occasion.

We have been working on Something for nearly a year.  Last September we hired the best design team we could find to create the Something mold.
 
Over the past 6 months we have made 5 prototypes (some 3-D printed and some silicone), each time tweaking the mold to make it easier to use and more readable.
3 of the prototypes
We are extremely happy with the design of the bakeform and have already made well over a hundred Somethings as we have tested the molds and explored the possibilities.  

We have our manufacturer lined up and we have already paid a deposit on the mold. They have started the tooling on the mold that will cast the final silicone bakeforms.

NOTE: The actual bakeform will be a dark red with the exception of the Kickstarter exclusive early bakeforms which will be green.

The bakeform will come attached to a spiral bound book with 365 ideas and recipes for Something. Many of the ideas and pictures will be submitted by you, our backers!!!

But wait - there's more!  We hope to make the back cover of the book  open up and become a stand for the book after you pop off your mold.
This is a concept drawing of what the idea book could look like and how the back cover could turn into a handy dandy stand for easy reading.
Something really is the perfect gift because the possibilities are endless. Take Something to a pot luck dinner.  Leave Something on the front porch for someone to step in.Tell your neighbor you left Something in their mailbox.The quips and anecdotes go on and on - trust us, we have been doing this for over a year.
This is your chance to stock up on Something and get Something early!

Get one for you and all your friends and family.  Plus, don't forget it will be even cooler to give the book to people when it has one of your ideas (and your name) in it!!!

Here are all the rewards for supporting something:
Some rewards come with the something extra package.  This means you will get a little bag of extras like: pens, stickers, magnets, and maybe even a SOMETHING tie tack if we hit $100,000. What and how many of these come in each extra package will be determined by stretch goals. For starters, it comes with something to write with:
When we hit $45,000 we will add something sticky to the extras package so you can put something on someone's shirt. (You know you want to say, "You have something on your shirt." to someone! ☺)
More extras will be revealed throughout the project!
For the most part the work on the mold is done.The exciting opportunity is we are counting on our early backers to make Something (hopefully a couple Somethings) and send in your ideas and pictures. If we use your ideas and/or pictures, we will give you credit in the book and if you have a website (you know who you are, you cookie and cake bloggers!) we will for sure include that in the book as well!!!

But can you imagine giving this to a friend and then turning to the page that has your name on it?  That is a COOL gift!
You can get even more books and bakeforms if you like!!! We have a goal to create 10,000,000 smiles.  This is just one of many projects to help us reach that goal. 

We are counting each Something bakeform shipped as 3 smiles towards our goal!

If you would like to add more bakeforms or bakeforms with books, just increase your pledge amount by $15 for every bakeform you want to add or $25 for every bakeform with book you want to add. And please message us to let us know what you are adding. (International backers, please add $5 per item for shipping.)

NOTE: If you back the $90 or up reward levels, you qualify for special pricing for additional books.
Thank you to all our backers who made SOMETHING happen!!!
If you missed the project check out:
www.BakingSomething.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my third project. I have a background in manufacturing and now I have a partner to help things run even more smoothly. Plus, we have a team of people to help with packaging and shipping. Our biggest task ahead is producing the cookbook. We already have about 200 solid ideas for Something but if no one sends in ideas and pictures, John and I will have to - I mean, will GET to make all the Somethings ourselves.
