campaign.story:
Muertos is an original set of American playing cards designed by Steve Minty and produced by the United States Playing Card Company (USPCC). It is independently crafted and honors the holiday that celebrates life and death; Dia De Los Muertos. The Muertos deck takes the classic aesthetics of Dia De Los Muertos and is updated with the tradition of playing and my experiences growing up. It depicts the social classes and history of the culture while simultaneously giving off a contemporary elegant luxurious feel.
150k Unlocked!
Color Deck Un-Cut Sheets!
Each is signed by me! The price remains the same as the other un-cut sheets ($25 for Domestic, $40 for international). I know it's very last minute but I wanted to offer something that would be cool! I will only make enough of these to fill orders and nothing more. Don't worry if you can't pledge for it now, it will be available in backerkit!
125k Unlocked!
 Now every back with at least 1 pledge of each Color Deck (Love Deck, Celebration Deck, & Sun Deck) will receive a pair of Red Love Dice and Celebrate Dice free of charge! This is a highly exclusive order and the dices will not be available for add-ons or swaps.
Dealer Button!
New dealer button that will be free with the 100, 300 & 500 Poker sets. Each dealer button is made from Acrylic and is approximately 4"x3". This dealer button is not available as an add-on!
 Optional Poker Chip Denominations!
Backers with the 100, 300 and 500 Pokerchips Set will now have the option of either getting their chips in non-numbered denominations or numbered denominations! The collector's set will still retain the non-numbered denominations. When you add a 100, 300, or 500 Poker Chip Set, message me your choice of either numbered or unnumbered denominations!
Enhanced Suit Design!
Numbered cards will now have updated suit designs to enhance visibility and functionality!
Different Backs for Color Decks vs Night Decks and Mourning Gold Decks!
  Back designs for the color decks (Love Deck, Celebration Deck, Sun Deck ) will have a similar yet different design. The design integrity remains the same but certain details have changed. This increases variety and value!
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I grew up in Los Angeles and at a very young age, I was exposed to a lot of different cultures, especially that of the Mexican heritage. There are many aspects of the culture that I become accustomed to, but it wasn’t until I started looking into my fear of death that I was introduced to the holiday known as Dia De Los Muertos. The imagery and symbolism of Dia De Los Muertos is incredibly beautiful and has a lot of whimsy and playfulness to it despite it involving the very somber topic of death.
My goal when creating the imagery for the Muertos deck is to honor the message that Dia De Los Muertos celebrates. From Aztec influences to José Posada’s works and even the Mexican-American Wars, I aimed to capture the social classes and implications that are set within the history of the culture. By encompassing all of it and expressing it in my style and my background, I feel it’s true to me and a product I am very proud of.
In the next couple of weeks, I hope to get work with you to release more awesome rewards and make Muertos come to life together!
Muertos Night Deck back design
Muertos Night Deck Aces
Muertos Night Deck Spade Face Cards - (Left to Right) El Padre, La Hermana, El Soldado
Muertos Night Deck Hearts Face Cards - (Left to Right) El Catrin, La Viuda, El Bandito
Muertos Night Deck Clubs Face Cards - (Left to Right) El Caudillo, La Bailarina, El Campesino
Muertos Night Deck Diamonds Face Cards - (Left to Right) El Azteca, La Catrina, El Caballero
Joker cards feature the Calaveras (sugar skull) and the Muertos Insignia.
The pips on numbered cards has been updated to a design that reflects the symmetry of traditional decks but is new and refreshing. 
Muertos Queen of Clubs - La Bailarina
Muertos King of Diamonds - El Azteca
Muertos Tuck Box Layout and Layers

The Muertos Night Deck come packaged in a black and grey embossed box featuring gold foil accents, and a grey tax stamp seal.
Muertos tuck box grey seal
Once $40,000 Stretch goal funding is reached, the limited Muertos: Mourning Gold Edition will be unlocked as an add-on.

Once $60,000 Stretch goal funding is reached 1 additional Mourning Gold Edition deck will be free for all backers with 3 Night Decks or More! Additional International Shipping for this extra deck will be on me!
Muertos Mourning Gold Deck
Muertos Mourning Gold Deck Ace
Muertos Love Deck
 The Muertos Love Deck is based on the blood that runs in our veins. They say that Blood is thicker than water and so is the love of family. Dia De Los Muertos brings family closer together to honor the dead and I couldn't help but use that as my source of inspiration.
Add the Muertos Love Deck for $15  
($17 for International Orders.)
Muertos Celebration Deck
The Muertos Celebration deck is based on the vibrant fun decorations of Dia De Los Muertos. From Papel Picado to Flower decorations, I looked to them all as a source of inspiration. These decks will be Kickstarter Exclusives!
Add the Muertos Celebration Deck for $15  
($17 for International Orders.)
Muertos Sun Deck
 The Muertos Sun Deck is based on the gifts of Marigold and the sky. Also known as cempazuchitl, cempasuchil or zempasuchitl, Marigolds are used during Dia De Los Muertos so that your deceased loved ones can find their way back home.
Add the Muertos Sun Deck for $15  
($17 for International Orders.)
Unlocked: Golden Muertos Seal Stretch Goal
Update: Golden Muertos Seal has been unlocked! 
When the project reaches $20,000, each tuck box will come with a gold custom seal with grey accents. 
Muertos Engraved Wooden Poker Chips
Instead of doing common ceramic or plastic poker chips, I decided to go with wood. The tactile feeling of engraved wood is great on the senses and is sure to stand out from the rest. These poker chips come in 3 sets, 100 pieces, 300 pieces, and 500 pieces.  Each denomination is made from a different wood type: White Ash, Cherry, Walnut, Mahogany, and Purple Heart. The 100 set comes with the first four denominations, while the rest comes with all five. Each set comes with an elegant polished wooden engraved case. Only 10 of each set will be made and will come with a numbered certificate of authenticity. Once it's gone, it's gone forever!

Add a 100 set for $250. ($285 for international orders.)
Add a 300 set for $500. ($545 for international orders.)
Add a 500 set for $750. ($800 for international orders.)
Now available! Muertos Poker Chips Collector's Set. Each set comes with 1 chip of each wood type + 1 Hardwood engraved display!

Add the Muertos Poker Chips Collector's set for $25
($35 for International Orders.)
Muertos Poker Case
New Reward Add-on! This beautiful wood engraved poker deck case holds 2 signed decks. 
Add a Poker Case for only $75.
($100 for international orders.)
Muertos Wooden Deck
  I don’t believe this reward has been done before, but I am very proud to offer this reward to the $500 and $1000 level backers. The cards are exquisite and feel remarkable in your hands. 
Due to the nature of wood, inconsistencies may occur.
Now Available! Muertos Black & Gold Dice
Add a pair of dice to any reward for only $5
($7 for international orders)
Now Available! Muertos Marbled Ivory Dice
 Add a pair of dice to any reward for only $5
($7 for international orders)
Stay true to Dia De Los Muertos with the In Memoriam Pledge.
Pass on the legacy of your loved one by having a custom Muertos Style portrait on an extra card that comes with every Muertos Night Deck. Only 1 available.
Black “Muertos” Tshirt (Available in S,M,L,XL, XXL).
Add a “Muertos' Tshirt to any Reward for just $15.
($20 for International orders.)
11” x 17” Muertos Hand-Pilled Screen Printed Poster. Numbered and printed on high quality paper stock.
Add a “Muertos' Poster to any Reward for just $20. 
($30 for International orders.) Frame not included with prints.
Antique Gold 1¾” Engraved Commemorative Coin can be used as a dealer button, card guard, display piece, or decision maker. The front side features the sugarskull and the back features the Muertos insignia.
Add a Muertos Coin to any Reward for just $10.
($12 for International orders.)
Once funding has reached $30,000, 1 Muertos coin will be free for all backers with a pledge of 3 decks or more!
How to get your sweet add-ons:
1. After you have pledged to the project there will be a blue Manage your pledge button on the right hand column as seen above.  
2. Increase your pledge in the Pledge Amount box by the total of the add-ons you want to add. Unless you want to change your tier at the same time, Do not change the tier you are currently pledged at. If you do change your tier, just add the total of add-ons to your new tier level. (If you are an international backer, please be sure to pledge the international amount)   
3. You then have to confirm your new pledge amount and will be sent to Amazon for checkout completion! 
4. Important! Be sure to message me about your add-ons so I can be sure to mark it down! It creates a lot less confusion at the end.
Video Credits:
Videographer: Alvin Dharmawan
Music: "Laid Back Guitars" - Kevin MacLeod
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have done a lot of research and followed up on a lot of companies to ensure that this project goes as smoothly as possible. There may be the risks of the unforeseen but I have prepared myself enough with knowledge and research to minimize it if necessary. I listed the delivery date conservatively in order to not rush the production of the product. As a designer and consumer, I know that it is necessary to have a high-end product and I am committed to delivering the best product possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

This deck was designed before my first Kickstarter campaign (Requiem Playing Cards), but it was stuck with a company that did not print it.  I took it back and improved the design and graphics. After five months work, it's finally on Kickstarter.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As Requiem Playing Cards, this is supposed to be a standard procedure, since printing a custom poker card deck is not a new technology. The deck will be printed by EPCC (Expert Playing Card Company at Conjuring Arts - NYC). I met the owner in person and checked the variety of paper stocks and finishing. 
EPCC is more flexible, dynamic and responsive than USPCC. They have lower costs and this means lower prices for the backers. 
The cards are printed with more precision and the Master Finish give a smooth feeling. If you have a Zenith or an Exquisite deck, you know what I mean.

Time to delivery is almost the same as USPCC. I will send the files of the cards during the campaign. Delays might happen, but I'll be as fast as possible, as I did for Requiem.

Many things might go wrong, you never know, the devil is in the details. I'll keep my eyes open and follow every single step of the project to make it real. I have more than 15 years of experience in graphic design and illustrations and Requiem is a proof.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Thanks to over one thousand amazing backers our first campaign was quite successful raising over $40,000 dollars. Over the past few months, while the art was being finished, I received dozens of messages from individuals asking if it was too late to become a backer. Because of the huge interest in this project, I've decided to launch this new campaign to give those who missed it a chance to join before we go into print. All the artwork is finished, and has been submitted to USPCC for approval. Once the art is approved we will be able to move forward with the printing process.
Below are the five main pledge rewards. The red and blue decks share the same face cards, but have unique backs and boxes. The Limited Edition deck is unique all around. There will only be 2500 Limited Edition decks ever printed. There are only 1000 Limited decks left. Back and save your copy today. 
Click on the images below to enlarge them in a new tab.
                                 Kickstarter gives us the opportunity to reach further and dream bigger. With the help of kickstarter, I successfully shipped two thousand packages all around the world. Because of the amazing kickstarter platform, my game will now be published by a major publishing company next year. Bringing the Kingdoms deck back to kickstarter will help us make an even larger print run, so we may bring this amazing deck to more card collectors, families and friends. Thank you all for the support. Without it, My game, and this deck wouldn't have been possible. And thank you Kickstarter for giving me the opportunity to live this creative life. 
The funds raised here will be added to the funds raised from our previous kickstarter campaign to allow us to do an even larger print run. The money will also go into packaging and shipping material.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Over the past year I have written over 84 kickstarter updates communicating with my backers letting them know step by step how my projects are proceeding. Dragon’s Hoard my first project has been delivered to all 1740 backers. I’m so grateful for all the support, which allowed me to manufacture and deliver a fantastic game. Dragon’s Hoard has been doing amazing. Dragon’s Hoard has been nominated for Best Toys For Kids. Further more, Tom Vasal said in his review that he’d go as far as nominate it for best artwork of the year. Because of Kickstarter, and nearly 2000 amazing supportive backers, Dragon’s Hoard is now available to everyone to enjoy. It has been such a hit that we have sold over 4000 copies so far. And even more exciting news, a major publisher will be publishing Dragon’s Hoard next year. All of this is possible because of backers like you. 

I have learned a lot about manufacturing, and delivering a product to my backers. It is not always easy. But in the end, I make sure I’m delivering the best product possible. The most common challenges are delays. With Dragon’s Hoard, because of the huge success and the many stretch goals, it took an additional two months to illustrate all the new artwork. The new artwork, of course, made the game much more stunning. The second delay happened when I sent the files to the printers. After I sent all the files, they kept asking me to change something, and re-send them. This process took a month, which was three times longer than expected. It was frustrating that they didn’t explain everything up front. However, now I have a keen knowledge of how printers want the files. Knowing this information has helped me deliver the files more smoothly to new manufactures. The third delay was a poorly executed proof. The printer wanted to have me sign off on a digital proof, but I refused, and said I need to see a physical proof. Once the physical proof arrived, I was glad I asked for it. It was unacceptably dark, way too dark. I took it into my own hands to print my own proof from a local printer. I then sent it over seas to my printer so they could use it to match the lightness. This worked perfectly. The next proofs they sent me were beautiful. Our fourth delay was because the printer held the game for two months after I signed off on the proofs before they even started printing it. This was by far the most frustrating challenge. The printer quoted a three-month turn around, but ended up taking more than twice as long to fulfill their promise. The last and final challenge was shipping out so many packages. I first was packing 50 packages a day and taking them down to my local post office, which only had one or two font desk workers. I would stand in line for half an hour before I’d even get to the front desk. Then I’d spend the next hour handing packages to the post officer. I did this for weeks. This was not working well. It was taking way to long. I started looking for other ways. I then found Endicia. It is a great online program where one can print your own shipping labels. This saved me so much time, and allowed me to deliver tracking numbers to my backers. In the end, I’m grateful for the amazing support of my backers, and their understanding. I’m confident that my projects in the future will be done more efficiently using the skills I’ve learned over the past year. 

My second project: Kingdoms of a New World raised over $40,000. The art has now been finished, and has been submitted to the printers for approval. Once approved, we will be moving forward with the print run. And my third project Steampunk Deck of playing cards is right on schedule for it’s estimated delivery date.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
A culinary term deconstructed describes a process of breaking apart a dish into key ingredients and reconstructing it into a new form; an inside-out apple pie is a good example.
playing cards
We are taking the elements of court cards and bring them into individual pips, closing the visual gap of the entire deck. In the process we create what I call “Royal Pips.”
playing cards
The process requires the highest quality printing of very thin lines and a perfect color registration; we will print the cards at the United States Playing Card Company.
I am still finalizing the design, so there may be some changes to the pips design before we go to print, but we are almost there.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
A playing card project is very time consuming. There are many elements that need to work together for backers to receive the decks of cards they pledged.

I completed another Kickstarter project fulfilling all pledges and learning quite a bit in the process. Depending on the size of pledges I may use a fulfillment center to ship all products to backers.

I’m trying to keep the rewards simple and easy to understand, with clear add on system.

Fulfillment is clearly the most difficult part of this project, as dealing with many packages and various orders is challenging. I have a lot of experience in these matters so we will either use Stamp.com with their automated system or give the entire project to the fulfillment center I can trust if the size of the shipment overpowers our limited in-house capabilities.

The deck will be printed at the United States Playing Card company, which was producing the highest quality products for decades. I am selecting a very conservative deadline for delivery of pledges to allow for unforeseen delays in printing of the cards.

The international shipping cost is difficult to estimate and it’s very high regardless of a carrier used. We will use United States Post Office for all shipments; we were very successful in the past shipping similar projects.

We will be using corrugated boxes for shipping to avoid a potential damage when shipped in a padded envelope. Although it adds to the cost I want to make sure the decks arrive without damage often associated with shipments using envelopes.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
From the creators of the Dark Templar & Steel playing cards comes a new deck: Bicycle® Mayhem. 
Made by Cardicians.
The Mayhem deck is about the freedom of creativity, inspired by many unique creative styles, yet when combined form a beautiful symbiosis. We chose the name Mayhem in reference to the theory that from Chaos comes order, the chaos in this deck being the conglomeration of the very different styles used in the design of this deck. Another exquisitely designed deck by Cardicians, and manufactured by the United States Playing Card Company, using only the finest quality paper stock for that flawless game play feel.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
A playing card project is a big task. There are so many elements that have to work together in order for a playing card project to function smoothly and result in decks of cards in the hands of satisfied backers.

This playing card project will be my 5th playing card project on Kickstarter. I have learned so much from my past Kickstarters, including some valuable lessons about what TO do, and what NOT to do.

Below are the three biggest hurdles with any playing card project, and how I plan to overcome them:

1. Keep your rewards & add on system simple and easy to understand.

As I did with both my Federal 52 Part II & Sherlock Holmes projects I have given the pledge tiers Alphanumeric labels to help you understand what you are pledging for. Beside every pledge tier there is a letter/number key that you can match up with a graphic that will give you a visual representation of what is included in that pledge tier.

2. Keep International Shipping transparent and easy to understand.

I have received my share of bumps and bruises in the past trying to figure out the most transparent and understandable method of communicating to international backers how much to add for Int. shipping. Int. Shipping is expensive, there is no way around it. I ship all of my decks using the USPS. It is not my intention to try and profit from international shipping I'm only trying not to go broke from it. I am totally transparent with shipping costs and have included an average breakdown of how much international shipping costs both you and me. Since all the information is out on the table, you can be a well-informed backer.

3. Fulfillment is by far the most difficult process of any playing card project.

With my first Federal 52 Project I got my hands calloused by tackling the fulfillment of 3000 orders by myself. With my second project, Federal 52 Part II, I ventured out and gave a fulfillment company a shot at taking on the challenge. I have learned that shipping playing cards is an art form in of itself. It is VERY important to me that that the same amount of care and detail is given to the packing and shipping of my playing cards as is going into the design. Because of this fact I have recently formed a company that specializes in nothing but shipping playing cards and add-ons for playing card projects. My fulfillment company is called Kings Wild Fulfillment. It has a full-time staff that is dedicated to handling, packing and shipping your rewards with a level of excellence that you expect from anything with the Kings Wild logo on it.

At this very moment Kings Wild Fulfillment is fulfilling 1500 orders for my previous card project, The Sherlock Holmes playing card project.

You may notice that my international shipping costs are a little higher than my previous projects. One thing that I am doing differently on this project is eliminating bubble wrapped envelopes for both domestic and international rewards. ALL rewards, whether you order 1 deck or 500 will arrive in a corrugated cardboard box. I will be using a variety of boxes from ULINE industructo boxes to USPS Priority flat rate boxes.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear Kings Wild Backers and Supporters, 
This spring Kings Wild turns 4 years old. We couldn’t have made it this far without your incredible support and encouragement. Because of that, we would like to invite all of you to attend our 4 year Birthday Party. We realize not all of you are local to the Austin area but we wanted to extend an invite regardless. Please reply to our Facebook event here: https://tinyurl.com/zasg2gt

Great news! Last night all but 17 orders were posted and packed. Your package/rewards were either sent out yesterday or will be today. I just wanted give shout out to Kevin, Kings Wild Fulfillment packing pro for an incredible job. I'm excited to say that we were able to fulfill this project almost a month early.
I also wanted to let you know that Kings Wild is trail blazing some great new features on Backerkit to help make your experience backing a Kings Wild Kickstarter even more enjoyable. If you log back into your Backerkit order you will see your tracking number listed under the "Special Notes" Section.

updates.update_userinfo: The V2 Moriarty Decks have arrived!
updates.update_content:
Great News everybody! The V2 Moriarty Decks have arrived! Fulfillment will begin first thing Monday morning. Thank you again for your support and patience.
Jackson

updates.update_userinfo: Production Update! Last day for Backerkit
updates.update_content:
Production Update!
How cool would it be if I said, "I will probably receive the Moriarty V2 reprints decks next week."?
Well...

updates.update_userinfo: V1 Special Edition Moriarty decks now available to all backers! Also now a 2 deck limit!
updates.update_content:
Hey guys! If you log back onto your Backerkit page you will see that the V1 Special Edition Moriarty Decks are now available to ALL backers of the the Reprint project. A new addon will now be visible for BOTH repeat and new backers.
The deck limit for each person has now been raised to 2 decks. These decks are first come first serve.

Hello everyone! I just wanted to let you guys know that the Backerkit process is now open. Every one who has completed their Kickstarter Survey will be receiving a Backerkit invitation some time today. Simply click the big green button to be redirected to your very own Backerkit Pledge Manager page. 
Here is what the email will look like:
It will be sent from support@kingswildproject.com so be sure to check your junk mail if you don't find it.

Thank You!
First off I want to say thank you so much for your incredible support and encouragement. It continues to amaze me at the incredible community and support I get with everyone of my projects. You guys really make all of this worth it... Thank you.
I also want to send a very special shout out to all of you who are backing me for the very first time. Thank you and I hope you will enjoy both this project's rewards and many to come.

Thank You
As we close into the final hours of the project I just wanted to give everyone of you a very special thank you for supporting this project. For of you who are repeat backers thank you so much for sticking with me and watching both my company and design style develop as a playing card creator. For all of my first time backers, welcome and I hope that this will be the first of many projects we make a reality.
Production Update
